en: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
hmr: Israel lal, David naupa Solomon thuvarhai chu:

en: To know wisdom and instruction; To discern the words of understanding;
hmr: Varna le inchûktirna hre dingin; Hrietthiemna thuhai hre dingin

en: To receive instruction in wise dealing, In righteousness and justice and equity;
hmr: Thilthaw vara inchûktirna dawng dingin, Felnaa le rorêlnaa le thlierbîk nei lonaa leh;

en: To give prudence to the simple, To the young man knowledge and discretion:
hmr: Mi mâwl kuoma varna pe ding le, Tlangvâl kuoma hrietna le ngairuotthiemna pe dingin,

en: That the wise man may hear, and increase in learning; And that the man of understanding may attain unto sound counsels:
hmr: Mi var chun a hriet a, thiemnaa chun a belsa theina ding le, Hrietthiemna nei mi chun rorêlna ṭhahai chu a changna dingin;

en: To understand a proverb, and a figure, The words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
hmr: Thuvar le tekhithu hrethiem ding le, Mi var thuhai le an thuril hrilhai chu hrethiem dingin.

en: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of knowledge; But the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.
hmr: LALPA ṭina chu hrietna bul a nih: Amiruokchu, invêt chun varna le inchûktirna chu an hmu- sit a.

en: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, And forsake not the law of thy mother:
hmr: Ka naupa, i pa inchûktirna hi ngai la, I nu inchûktirna chu nghatsan naw rawh;

en: For they shall be a chaplet of grace unto thy head, And chains about thy neck.
hmr: I lua chun pâr ṭhi mawitak nîng an ta, I rîng vêla chun ṭhi ang an ni ding a ni sih a.

en: My son, if sinners entice thee, Consent thou not.
hmr: Ka naupa, mi suolhaiin an thlêm che chun Remtipui el naw rawh.

en: If they say, Come with us, Let us lay wait for blood; Let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause;
hmr: Hienghin ti sien khawm, “Keini leh hung la, Thisen inchân ei ta, A san um loin mi pawitâwk- lo chu inrûkin inchân ei ta;

en: Let us swallow them up alive as Sheol, And whole, as those that go down into the pit;
hmr: Seol ang elin an hring pumin lem ei ta; Mi felhai ngei chu, vânsama fethlahai ang elin;

en: We shall find all precious substance; We shall fill our houses with spoil;
hmr: Thil hluhai po po chu hmûng ei ta, Ei inhai chu râllâk thilin suksip ei ta;

en: Thou shalt cast thy lot among us; We will all have one purse:
hmr: I chanpuol chu keini lai sielût ve la, Ei rêngin sumbâwm khat ei nei ding annâwm” tiin.

en: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; Refrain thy foot from their path:
hmr: Ka naupa, anni chu lampuia chun intlawnpui naw la, An lampuia inthawk chun i ke chu vêng ṭha rawh.

en: For their feet run to evil, And they make haste to shed blood.
hmr: An kehai chu rîtlona tieng a tlân a, Thisen insuo dingin an inhmaw sih a.

en: For in vain is the net spread In the sight of any bird:
hmr: Vate hrim hrim mithmua lên keiphar chu; A thlâwn el a ni sih a.

en: And these lay wait for their own blood; They lurk privily for their own lives.
hmr: Chun, chuong anni thisen ngei inchântuhai chun, Anni hringna ngei chu inrûkin an inchân a nih.

en: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; It taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
hmr: Hlêpnaa duâm mi taphawthai lampui chu chuong ang chu a nih; A neituhai hringna chu a lâk hmang hlak.

en: Wisdom crieth aloud in the street; She uttereth her voice in the broad places;
hmr: Varna chu kawtthlêra chun inringtakin a khêk a; Khawlaiahai chun a râwl chu ân suoh a.

en: She crieth in the chief place of concourse; At the entrance of the gates, In the city, she uttereth her words:
hmr: Kawtthlêr inrîk mur murna hmun takhaia chun a khêk a, Dâi kawtkhâr lûtnaa dâm chun. Khawpui sûnga chun a thuhai chu a hril a.

en: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? And scoffers delight them in scoffing, And fools hate knowledge?
hmr: Ieng chen am nangni mi mâwlhai, mâwlna hi in hmangai ding a na? Hmusittuhai chu an hmusitnaa chun an lâwmin, Invêthai chun ieng chen am hrietna chu in theida ding a na?

en: Turn you at my reproof: Behold, I will pour out my spirit upon you; I will make known my words unto you.
hmr: Ka kâwknaa hin nghakîr unla, Ngai ta u, in kuoma chun ka thlarau chu hung buok ka ta, Ka thuhai chu in kuomah inhriettir ka ti cheu.

en: Because I have called, and ye have refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man hath regarded;
hmr: Ka ko cheu a, in ngaisak nawh a, Ka bân ka pharsuok a, tu- khawma in ngaisak nawh a,

en: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, And would none of my reproof:
hmr: Ka thurâwn chu iengkhawm loah in siem a, Ka kâwkna a ieng khawm chu in ngai naw leiin,

en: I also will laugh in the day of your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
hmr: Kei khawm in lunginzing nia chun innui ka ta, In ṭitna hung pha khawm chun nuisan ka tih,

en: When your fear cometh as a storm, And your calamity cometh on as a whirlwind; When distress and anguish come upon you.
hmr: In ṭitna chu thlipui angin, In lunginzîngna chu thlivir angin a hung a, Rimsikna le tuorna chu in chungah a tlung pha chun;

en: Then will they call upon me, but I will not answer; They will seek me diligently, but they shall not find me:
hmr: Chun, kei chu mi hung ko an ta, nisienlakhawm, dawn naw ningah; Nguntakin mi hung zawng an ta, nisienlakhawm, mi hmu naw hi hai.

en: For that they hated knowledge, And did not choose the fear of Jehovah,
hmr: Hrietna chu an theidah a, LALPA ṭîna chu an thlang nawh a,

en: They would none of my counsel, They despised all my reproof.
hmr: Ka thurâwn a ieng ieng khawm an zâwm nawh a, Ka kâwkna po po chu an hmusit a,

en: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, And be filled with their own devices.
hmr: Chuleiin, anni lampui rasuok ngei chu fâng an ta, An thiltumhai ngeia suksip ni tâng an tih.

en: For the backsliding of the simple shall slay them, And the careless ease of fools shall destroy them.
hmr: Mi mâwl hnungtawlna chun anni chu sukhlum a ta, Invêthai nuomsakbâwlna chun anni chu a suksiet ding a ni sih a.

en: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell securely, And shall be quiet without fear of evil.
hmr: Amiruokchu, tukhawm keia thu ngai chu himtakin chêng a ta, Rîtlona ṭi dêr loin um ṭawk ṭawk a tih.

en: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father; But a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
hmr: Solomon Thuvarhai chu. Naupa var chun pa lâwm a siem a, Naupa invêt ruok chu nu ta dingin phurrik a nih.

en: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing; But righteousness delivereth from death.
hmr: Khawhlona rohai chu ienga khawm a hlâwk nawh a, Felna ruok chun thinaa inthawkin a san suok.

en: Jehovah will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish; But he thrusteth away the desire of the wicked.
hmr: Mi fel hringna chu a ṭâm LALPA chun phal naw nih a, Mi khawhlo thilchâk chu a hnawt hmang.

en: He becometh poor that worketh with a slack hand; But the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
hmr: Kut zawia sinthaw chu a hung pase a, Kut taima ruok chun ama chu a sukhausa.

en: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son; But he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
hmr: Nipui laia la khâwmtu chu naupa var a na, Busîk huna ininnghil ruok chu naupa, inzakna intluntu chu a nih.

en: Blessings are upon the head of the righteous; But violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
hmr: Mi fel lu chunga chun malsâwmnahai a um a, Mi khawhlo bau ruok chu nunsietnain ân khum.

en: The memory of the righteous is blessed; But the name of the wicked shall rot.
hmr: Mi indik hriet zingna chu malsâwmin a um a, Mi khawhlo hming ruok chu thâm hmang a tih.

en: The wise in heart will receive commandments; But a prating fool shall fall.
hmr: Lungrila var chun thupêkhai pawm a ta, Hmûr khêlinhlip ruok chu sukhnuoi nîng a tih.

en: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely; But he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
hmr: Mi tluongtaka fe chu ngamtakin a feh a, A lampuihai pêtsantu ruok chu hriet nîng a tih.

en: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow; But a prating fool shall fall.
hmr: Mi a mit sêp sêp vêltu chun lungngaina ân tlungtir a, Hmûr khêlinhlip ruok chu sukhnuoi nîng a tih.

en: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life; But violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
hmr: Mi fel bau chu hringna tuikhur a na, Mi khawhlo bau ruok chu nunsietnain ân khum.

en: Hatred stirreth up strifes; But love covereth all transgressions.
hmr: Theidana chun inkhingna a chawk suok a, Hmangaina ruok chun bawsietna po po ân khum hmang.

en: In the lips of him that hath discernment wisdom is found; But a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
hmr: Hrietthiemna neitu hmûrhaia chun varna hmu a na, Hmawl ruok chu mi hrietthiemna boa um ruongzâng ta ding a nih.

en: Wise men lay up knowledge; But the mouth of the foolish is a present destruction.
hmr: Mi var chun hrietna a siekhâwl a, Mi invêt bau ruok chu sietna zing a nih.

en: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: The destruction of the poor is their poverty.
hmr: Mi hausa hausakna chu a khawpui det a na, Mi pasie suksietna ruok chu an pasietna a nih.

en: The labor of the righteous tendeth to life; The increase of the wicked, to sin.
hmr: Mi fel sininrimna chun hringna ân tlun a, Mi khawhlo hlâwkna chun suolna.

en: He is in the way of life that heedeth correction; But he that forsaketh reproof erreth.
hmr: Sukdikna pawisatu chu hring- na lampuiah a um a nih, Kâwkna nghatsantu ruok chun a suksuol hlak.

en: He that hideth hatred is of lying lips; And he that uttereth a slander is a fool.
hmr: Hmûr khêlinhlipa theidana chu ip a; Demna thu sâksuoktu chu invêt a nih.

en: In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression; But he that refraineth his lips doeth wisely.
hmr: Thu um khâwm ṭeu laia hin bawsietna a bo nawh a; A hmûr vêngṭhatu ruok chun vartakin a thaw a nih.

en: The tongue of the righteous is as choice silver: The heart of the wicked is little worth.
hmr: Mi fel lei chu tangka ditum ang a na, Mi khawhlo lungril chu man tlâwmte a nih.

en: The lips of the righteous feed many; But the foolish die for lack of understanding.
hmr: Mi fel hmûrhai chun mi tamtak a châwm a, Invêt ruok chu hrietthiemna tlasamin a thi.

en: The blessing of Jehovah, it maketh rich; And he addeth no sorrow therewith.
hmr: LALPA malsâwmna chun a siem hausa a, Chutaka chun lungngaina a belsa nawh.

en: It is as sport to a fool to do wickedness; And so is wisdom to a man of understanding.
hmr: Khawhlona thaw hi invêt ta ding chun ruolsiekna ang a na, Chuong ang bawk chun, hrietthiemna nei mi ta dingin varna chu a nih.

en: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him; And the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
hmr: Mi khawhlo ṭitna chu ama chung ngeiah hung tlung a ta, Mi fel ditna chu inhlawtlingtir nîng a tih.

en: When the whirlwind passeth, the wicked is no more; But the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
hmr: Thlivir chu a fe hmang el hlak angin, mi khawhlo chu a um ta nawh a, Nisienlakhawm, mi fel chu kumkhaw lungphûm ang a nih.

en: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, So is the sluggard to them that send him.
hmr: Uoin thûrin ha a sukṭim ang le, meikhuin mithai a sukthîp angin, Chuong ang chu a nih mi thabo chu a tirtuhai ta dingin.

en: The fear of Jehovah prolongeth days; But the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
hmr: LALPA ṭina chun nihai chu a suksei a, Mi khawhlo kumhai ruok chu suktâwi nîng a tih.

en: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness; But the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
hmr: Mi fel beiseina chu lâwmna nîng a ta, Mi khawhlo beiseina ruok chu bohmang a tih.

en: The way of Jehovah is a stronghold to the upright; But it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
hmr: LALPA lampui chu mi tluong ta ding chun kul nghettak a na, Suolna thawtuhai ta ding ruok chun bohmangna a nih.

en: The righteous shall never be removed; But the wicked shall not dwell in the land.
hmr: Mi fel chu sawn hmang ni ngai naw nih a, Mi khawhlo ruok chu hnuoia hin chêng naw nih.

en: The mouth of the righteous bringeth forth wisdom; But the perverse tongue shall be cut off.
hmr: Mi fel bau chun varna a phusuok a, Lei khêlinhlip ruok chu ât bawng nîng a tih.

en: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable; But the mouth of the wicked speaketh perverseness.
hmr: Mi fel hmûrhai chun lâwm tlâkhai chu a hriet a, Mi khawhlo bau ruok chun khêlthu a sâk suok hlak.

en: A false balance is an abomination to Jehovah; But a just weight is his delight.
hmr: Bûkna indik naw chu LALPA ta dingin tirdakum a nih; Inkhîna indik ruok chu a lâwm zâwng a nih.

en: When pride cometh, then cometh shame; But with the lowly is wisdom.
hmr: Chapona chu a hung pha chun, inzaknain a hung zui; Varna ruok chu inngaitlâwmhai kuomah a um.

en: The integrity of the upright shall guide them; But the perverseness of the treacherous shall destroy them.
hmr: Mi tluong chu a lungril indiktak chun ṭhuoi a ta, Bawsetuhai ruok chu an khêl- inhlipnain anni suksieng a tih.

en: Riches profit not in the day of wrath; But righteousness delivereth from death.
hmr: Lungsen nia chun hausakna chu a ṭhahnem chuong nawh a, Felna ruok chun thinaa inthawkin a sansuok.

en: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way; But the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
hmr: Mi fel famkim chu a felna chun a lampui kâwkhmûng a ta, Mi khawhlo ruok chu a khawhlonaa ngei chun tlu lem a tih.

en: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them; But the treacherous shall be taken in their own iniquity.
hmr: Mi tluong chu an felna chun anni sansuok a ta, Ringmawumtaka thawtuhai ruok chu an thil sukpawi ngei chun anni lâng a tih.

en: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish; And the hope of iniquity perisheth.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu a thi chun, a beiseina chu bohmang a tih, Mi fel naw beiseina chu bohmang bawk a tih.

en: The righteous is delivered out of trouble; And the wicked cometh in his stead.
hmr: Mi fel chu buoinaa inthawk san suokin a um a, A hmuna chun mi khawhlo chu a lût hlak.

en: With his mouth the godless man destroyeth his neighbor; But through knowledge shall the righteous be delivered.
hmr: Pathien ngaisak naw mi chun a bauin a tuolbâwm chu a suksiet a, Mi fel ruok chu hrietna leia sanhim a nih.

en: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; And when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
hmr: Mi fel le ṭhataka a khawsak sûng po, khawpui chu a hlim hlak, Chun, mi khawhlo chu a bohmang pha chun khêkri a um hlak.

en: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted; But it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
hmr: Mi tluong malsâwmna leiin khawpui chu chawimawiin a um a, Nisienlakhawm, mi khawhlo baua pei thlâkin a um hlak.

en: He that despiseth his neighbor is void of wisdom; But a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
hmr: A tuolbâwm ngainêptu chu varna bo a nih, Mi hrietthiemna nei mi ruok chu a to ṭawk ṭawk.

en: He that goeth about as a tale-bearer revealeth secrets; But he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth a matter.
hmr: Mi lâwt vêltu anga invâk vêl chun thurûk a phawr hlak a, Mi lungril ringumtak ruok chun thu chu a ip hlak.

en: Where no wise guidance is, the people falleth; But in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
hmr: Inṭhuoina var um nawnaa chun mi an tlu hlak a, Thurâwntu tamtakhai lai ruok chun himna a um.

en: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it; But he that hateth suretyship is secure.
hmr: Hmêlmak mi ta dinga aiawtu ni chu kawisieng a ta, Aiawtu nina theidatu ruok chu nghet lem a tih.

en: A gracious woman obtaineth honor; And violent men obtain riches.
hmr: Nuhmei zângaithei chun inzâumna a kawl zing a, Pasal kâwlhrâwng chun hausaknahai a kawl hlak.

en: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul; But he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
hmr: Mi zainêmtak chun a lungril ta ding ngeiin thil ṭha a thawh a, Mi rilo ruok chun ama tisa ngei a sukbuoi.

en: The wicked earneth deceitful wages; But he that soweth righteousness hath a sure reward.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chun hlaw hmusit- umtakhai chu a hlawh a, Felna tutu ruok chun lâwmman indiktak chu a hmuh.

en: He that is stedfast in righteousness shall attain unto life; And he that pursueth evil doeth it to his own death.
hmr: Felnaa ngîr det tlattu chun hringna chu hmûng a ta, Suolna hnawttu chun a thina ding ngeiin a thaw a nih.

en: They that are perverse in heart are an abomination to Jehovah; But such as are perfect in their way are his delight.
hmr: Lungrila khêlinhliphai chu LALPA ta dingin tirdakum an na, An lampuia fel famkimhai ruok chu a lâwm zâwng an nih.

en: Though hand join in hand, the evil man shall not be unpunished; But the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
hmr: Mi rilo chu hrem naw ni naw ni, Mi fel thla ruok chu sanhim nîng a tih.

en: As a ring of gold in a swine’s snout, So is a fair woman that is without discretion.
hmr: Nuhmei hmêlṭha ngairuotthiemna neilo chu, Vawkpui hnâra rângkachak kutsebi ang a nih.

en: The desire of the righteous is only good; But the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
hmr: Mi fel dit zâwng chu thil ṭha chau a nih, Mi rilo beiseina chu lungsenna chau a nih.

en: There is that scattereth, and increaseth yet more; And there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth only to want.
hmr: Semdar raka pung deu deu si a um a, Mamaw tâwk bâk inro tlata tlasam si a um bawk a.

en: The liberal soul shall be made fat; And he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
hmr: Mi tiktlai chu sukthâu nîng a ta, Tui buoktu chu, ama ngei khawm tui buokkhum nîng a tih.

en: He that withholdeth grain, the people shall curse him; But blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
hmr: Bu inrotu chu miin ṭawngsie inphur an tih, A zawrtu lu chunga ruok chun malsâwmna um lem a tih.

en: He that diligently seeketh good seeketh favor; But he that searcheth after evil, it shall come unto him.
hmr: Thil ṭha nguntaka zawngtu chun ditsakna a zawng a nih, Pawitâwkna zawngtu chunga ruok chun pawitâwkna chu tlung a tih.

en: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; But the righteous shall flourish as the green leaf.
hmr: A hausaknahai ring mi chu tlûng a ta, Mi fel ruok chu hna hring angin inno a tih.

en: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind; And the foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.
hmr: Mi ama in ngei sukbuoitu chun takbo ro hluong a ta, Mi invêt chu lungril var kuoma siehlaw nîng a tih.

en: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; And he that is wise winneth souls.
hmr: Mi fel ra chu hringna thingkûng a na, Lungrilhai latu chu mi var a nih.

en: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth; How much more the wicked and the sinner!
hmr: Ngai ta, mi fel chu hnuoia hin thung nîng a ta, Mi suol le mi khawhlohai khawm chu thung an va ni nasa awm de!

en: Whoso loveth correction loveth knowledge; But he that hateth reproof is brutish.
hmr: Inchûktirna ngainatu chun hrietna a ngaina a, Kâwkna theidatu ruok chu intlaw a nih.

en: A good man shall obtain favor of Jehovah; But a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
hmr: Mi ṭha chun LALPA ditsakna hmûng a ta, Thiltum khawhlo nei mi ruok chu thiemnaw inchangtir a tih.

en: A man shall not be established by wickedness; But the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
hmr: Mihriem chu khawhlonain indinsuok an ni ngai nawh a, Mi fel zung ruok chu sawnhmang a ni ngai nawh.

en: A worthy woman is the crown of her husband; But she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
hmr: Nuhmei ringum chu a pasal ta dingin lallukhum a na, Thil inzapuium thawtu ruok chu a ruhai ta dingin inngêna ang a nih.

en: The thoughts of the righteous are just; But the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
hmr: Mi fel ngaituohai chu thil indik a na, Mi khawhlo thurâwn ruok chu inhlêmna a nih.

en: The words of the wicked are of lying in wait for blood; But the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
hmr: Mi khawhlo thuhai chu thisen insuo dinga inchântu a na, Nisienlakhawm, mi fel bau chun anni a san suok hlak.

en: The wicked are overthrown, and are not; But the house of the righteous shall stand.
hmr: Mi khawhlohai chu pei thlâkin an um a, an um ta nawh a, Nisienlakhawm, mi fel insûng ruok chu a ngîr zing hlak.

en: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom; But he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
hmr: Mi chu a varna anghu peiin hrilmawi nîng a ta, Lungril khêlinhlip nei mi ruok chu ngainêp nîng a tih.

en: Better is he that is lightly esteemed, and hath a servant, Than he that honoreth himself, and lacketh bread.
hmr: Mi mâni le mâni insiechunga, fâk ding nei lo nêkin, Mi ngainatum raklo, siehlaw nei si kha a ṭha lem.

en: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast; But the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
hmr: Mi fel chun a ran hai hringna chu a ngaisak a, Mi suol zângaina innêm ruok chu a rilo.

en: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread; But he that followeth after vain persons is void of understanding.
hmr: A hnuoi inlettu chun bei nei ṭeu a ta, Mi teplohai zuitu ruok chu hrietthiemna bo a nih.

en: The wicked desireth the net of evil men; But the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
hmr: Misuol chun mi rilohai lên chu a ditpui a, Mi fel zung ruok chun ra ân suo.

en: In the transgression of the lips is a snare to the evil man; But the righteous shall come out of trouble.
hmr: Hmûrhai bawsietnaa chun mi rilo châng chu a um a, Mi fel ruok chu buoinaa in- thawk chun hung suok a tih.

en: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth; And the doings of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.
hmr: A baua ra thil ṭha chun mi chu suktlai nîng a ta, Ama kut thilthawhai ngei chu a kuomah pêk nîng a tih.

en: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes; But he that is wise hearkeneth unto counsel.
hmr: Ama mithaia chun mi invêt lampui chu ân dik a, Mi var ruok chun thurâwn chu a ngai hlak.

en: A fool’s vexation is presently known; But a prudent man concealeth shame.
hmr: Invêt lungsenna chu hriet uor a ni hlak a, Mi var ruok chun inzakna chu a thuphmang hlak.

en: He that uttereth truth showeth forth righteousness; But a false witness, deceit.
hmr: Thutak sâksuok hlaktu chun felna chu ân entir a, Hrepuitu inkhêl ruok chun hlêmna ân entir hlak.

en: There is that speaketh rashly like the piercings of a sword; But the tongue of the wise is health.
hmr: Kâwlhnâm isun anga tlahawltaka thuhril a um a, Mi var lei ruok chu a hrisêl a nih.

en: The lip of truth shall be established for ever; But a lying tongue is but for a moment.
hmr: Thutak hmûr chu kumkhuoa tungding nîng a ta, Lei khêlinhlip ruok chu mit- khapkâr chaua ding a nih.

en: Deceit is in the heart of them that devise evil; But to the counsellors of peace is joy.
hmr: Rîtlona rawt suoktuhai lung- rila chun hlêmna a um a; Inremna rawt suoktuhai kuoma ruok chun hlimna a um.

en: There shall no mischief happen to the righteous; But the wicked shall be filled with evil.
hmr: Mi fel kuoma chun thil pawi hrim tlung naw nih a, Mi suol ruok chu rîtlonaa suksip nîng a tih.

en: Lying lips are an abomination to Jehovah; But they that deal truly are his delight.
hmr: Hmûr khêlinhliphai chu LALPA ta dingin tirdakum an na, Indiktaka thawtuhai ruok chu a lâwmna an ni hlak.

en: A prudent man concealeth knowledge; But the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
hmr: Mi var chun hrietna chu a thup a, Invêthai lungril ruok chun invêtna a tlânginsampui.

en: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule; But the slothful shall be put under taskwork.
hmr: Mi taima kut chun rorêlna chu kawl a ta, Mi thabo ruok chu sin inthawluitirna hnuoia sie nîng a tih.

en: Heaviness in the heart of a man maketh it stoop; But a good word maketh it glad.
hmr: Mihriem lungrila inlung- khamna chun a sukkûn a, Thu ṭha ruok chun a suklâwm hlak.

en: The righteous is a guide to his neighbor; But the way of the wicked causeth them to err.
hmr: Mi fel chu a tuolbâwm ta dingin ṭhuoitu a na, Mi khawhlo lampui ruok chun ân suksuoltir hlak.

en: The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting; But the precious substance of men is to the diligent.
hmr: Mi thabo chun a ramsuoknaa a lâk chu a raw nawh a, Amiruokchu, mihriema thil hlutak. chu taima kuomah a um;

en: In the way of righteousness is life; And in the pathway thereof there is no death.
hmr: Felna lampuia chun hringna a um a; Chu lampuia chun thina a um nawh.

en: A wise son heareth his father’s instruction; But a scoffer heareth not rebuke.
hmr: Naupa var chun a pa inchûktirna chu a ngai a, Hmusittu ruok chun kâwkna chu a ngai nawh.

en: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth; But the soul of the treacherous shall eat violence.
hmr: Miin a bau rasuoka inthawkin thil ṭha chu fâng a ta, Mi ringum naw lungril ruok chun hrângsietna fâng a tih.

en: He that guardeth his mouth keepeth his life; But he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
hmr: A bau vêng ṭhatu chun a hringna a kawl ṭha a, A hmûrhai ka lientu ruok chun suksietna tuok a tih.

en: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing; But the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
hmr: Mi thabo lungril chun a châk hlaka chu, iengkhawm a nei nawh, Mi taima lungril ruok chu sukthâu nîng a tih.

en: A righteous man hateth lying; But a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
hmr: Mi fel chun khêl hril a theida a, Mi khawhlo ruok chun inzakna a siemin kâwkna a lâk lût hlak.

en: Righteousness guardeth him that is upright in the way; But wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
hmr: Kawnglama mi tluong chu felnain ama a vêng a, Khawhlona ruok chun mi suol chu a buon thlûk.

en: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: There is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great wealth.
hmr: Ama le ama insukhausa a, iengkhawm nei silo a um a, Ama le ama insukpase a, hau- sakna nasatak nei a um bawk.

en: The ransom of a man’s life is his riches; But the poor heareth no threatening.
hmr: Mihriem hringna intlanna chu a hausaknahai a nih, Mi pasie ruok chun inṭhina chu a ngai nawh.

en: The light of the righteous rejoiceth; But the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
hmr: Mi fel varna chu a hlim a, Mi khawhlo khâwnvar ruok chu herhlum nîng a tih.

en: By pride cometh only contention; But with the well-advised is wisdom.
hmr: Chaponaa chun inkhingna a suok a, Thurâwn ṭhataka ruok chun varna a um.

en: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished; But he that gathereth by labor shall have increase.
hmr: Teplo mei meia hausakna hmu chu kiem a ta, Sininrima la khâwmtu chun a pung hmûng a tih.

en: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick; But when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
hmr: Beisei hlawsamna chun lungril a sukdam nawh a, Châk zâwng hung tlung ruok chu hringna thing a nih.

en: Whoso despiseth the word bringeth destruction on himself; But he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
hmr: Tukhawm thu hmusittu chun ama chungah sietna ân tlun hlak a, Thupêk ṭitu ruok chu lâwmman pêkin um a tih.

en: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, That one may depart from the snares of death.
hmr: Mi var inchûktirna chu hringna tuikhur a na, Thina chânghaia inthawka fe kiengna leh.

en: Good understanding giveth favor; But the way of the transgressor is hard.
hmr: Hrietthiemna ṭha chun ditsakna a chang a, Mi ringum naw lampui ruok chu a kherinkhâwng.

en: Every prudent man worketh with knowledge; But a fool flaunteth his folly.
hmr: Mi var tinhai chun hrietna leh sin an thawh a, Mi invêt ruok chun invêtna chu a thedar.

en: A wicked messenger falleth into evil; But a faithful ambassador is health.
hmr: Thangko khawhlo chu thil suolah a tlu hlak a, Aiawtu ringum ruok chu a hrisêl a nih.

en: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth correction; But he that regardeth reproof shall be honored.
hmr: Tlâksamna le inzakna chu inchûktirna sêlkaltu kuoma chun um an ta, Kâwkna pawisatu ruok chu chawimawi nîng a tih.

en: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul; But it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.
hmr: Nuom zâwng sukfamkim hi lungrila chun a thlum a, Amiruokchu, suolnaa inthawka fe kieng hi invêthai ta ding chun tirdakum a nih.

en: Walk with wise men, and thou shalt be wise; But the companion of fools shall smart for it.
hmr: Mi varhai intlawnpui la, nang khawm var i tih, Mi invêthai inruolpui ruok chu suksiet nîng a tih.

en: Evil pursueth sinners; But the righteous shall be recompensed with good.
hmr: Thil ṭha naw chun mi suolhai chu a hnawt pei a, Mi fel ruok chu thil ṭhaa thung nîng a tih.

en: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children; And the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the righteous.
hmr: Mi ṭha chun a tuhai ta ding chenin rohluo ding a mâkpêk hlak a, Mi suol hausakna chu mi fel ta dinga siekhâwl chau a nih.

en: Much food is in the tillage of the poor; But there is that is destroyed by reason of injustice.
hmr: Mi pasie hnuoi inletnaa chun bu tamtak a um a, Amiruokchu, remruot fel naw leia suksiet chutaka chun a um.

en: He that spareth his rod hateth his son; But he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
hmr: A hmawl hlatu chun a naupa a theida a, Ama hmangaitu ruok chun taimatakin a thunun hlak.

en: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul; But the belly of the wicked shall want.
hmr: Mi fel chun a lungrila a dittâwkin a fâk hlak a, Mi khawhlo phîng ruok chu tlasam a tih.

en: Every wise woman buildeth her house; But the foolish plucketh it down with her own hands.
hmr: Nuhmei var taphawt chun a in chu a bâwl a, Nuhmei invêt ruok chun a kuthaiin a ṭhiek hlak.

en: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth Jehovah; But he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
hmr: Mi, felnaa fe chun LALPA chu a ṭih a, A lampuihaia khêlinhlip ruok chun ama a hmusit hlak.

en: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod for his pride; But the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
hmr: Mi invêt baua chun chapona hmawl a um a, Mi var hmûrhai ruok chun hla lem a tih.

en: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean; But much increase is by the strength of the ox.
hmr: Bâwngchalhai um nawnaa chun ran in chu a fai a, Amiruokchu, hlâwkna nasatak chu bâwngchal hrâtna lei a nih.

en: A faithful witness will not lie; But a false witness uttereth lies.
hmr: Thuhretu ringum chu inkhêl naw nih a, Thuhretu indik naw ruok chun khêl hril a tih.

en: A scoffer seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not; But knowledge is easy unto him that hath understanding.
hmr: Hmusittu chun varna a zawng hlak a, a hmu ngai nawh, Hrietthiemna neitu ta ding ruok chun thiemna chu a awlsam hlak.

en: Go into the presence of a foolish man, And thou shalt not perceive in him the lips of knowledge.
hmr: Mi invêt hmaihmaa inthawk chun fe hmang rawh, Amaa inthawk chun thiemna hmûrhai hmu chuong naw ti nih.

en: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way; But the folly of fools is deceit.
hmr: Mi var varna chu a lampui hrietthiem chu a na, Mi invêt invêtna ruok chu khêlthu chu a nih.

en: A trespass-offering mocketh fools; But among the upright there is good will.
hmr: Mi suol chun suolna chu an nuisan a, Mi tluonghai laia ruok chun Pathien ditsakna chu a um.

en: The heart knoweth its own bitterness; And a stranger doth not intermeddle with its joy.
hmr: Lungril chun ama khâkna tak chu a hriet a, Hmêlmak mi chun an hlimna chu a sukbuoi ngai nawh.

en: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown; But the tent of the upright shall flourish.
hmr: Mi khawhlo in chu nam thlûk nîng a ta, Mi tluong puon in ruok chu um rân a tih.

en: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man; But the end thereof are the ways of death.
hmr: Mihriem kuoma indik âwmtak- a inlang lampui chu a um a, Chu tâwpna ruok chu thina lampuihai a nih.

en: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; And the end of mirth is heaviness.
hmr: Innuinaa ngei khawm lungril chu a lungngai a, Chu hlimna tâwpna chu chungrikna a nih.

en: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways; And a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
hmr: Lungrila hnungtawltu chu ama lampuihai ngeia suksip nîng a ta, Chun, mi ṭha chu amaa inthawk ngei chun suktlai nîng a tih.

en: The simple believeth every word; But the prudent man looketh well to his going.
hmr: Mi mâwl chun thu tinrêng el hi a ring a, Mi var ruok chun a fena chu a en ngun hlak.

en: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil; But the fool beareth himself insolently, and is confident.
hmr: Mi var chun suol chu a ṭih a, a fe hmangsan hlak a, Mi invêt ruok chun chaponain a hmang a, ama ân ring tlat hlak.

en: He that is soon angry will deal foolishly; And a man of wicked devices is hated.
hmr: Lunginsen awltak chun invêttakin thaw rawp a ta, Chun, mi remruotna khawhlo neitu chu theida ni bawk a tih.

en: The simple inherit folly; But the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
hmr: Mi mâwl chun invêtna ro chu a hluo a, Mi varhai ruok chu thiemna inkhumtirin an um.

en: The evil bow down before the good; And the wicked, at the gates of the righteous.
hmr: Mi suol chu mi ṭha hmaa chun a kûn a, Mi khawhlo chu mi fel daikawtkhârhaia chun a kûn bawk a.

en: The poor is hated even of his own neighbor; But the rich hath many friends.
hmr: Mi pasie chu a tuolbâwmhai ngei khawma theida a ni hlak a, Mi hausa ruok chun ruolhai tamtak a nei.

en: He that despiseth his neighbor sinneth; But he that hath pity on the poor, happy is he.
hmr: A tuolbâwm hmusittu chun a suksuol a na, Mi pasie chunga lunginsietna nei ruok chu a hlim a nih.

en: Do they not err that devise evil? But mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
hmr: Thil ṭha naw rawt suoktuhai chun an suksuol a ni naw am a nih? Thil ṭha rawt suoktuhai kuoma ruok chun thutak le lunginsietna um a tih.

en: In all labor there is profit; But the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
hmr: Sininrimna po poa hin hlâwkna a um a, Hmûrhaia a hrila hril ngawt el hi chu tlâksamnaah ân nghat.

en: The crown of the wise is their riches; But the folly of fools is only folly.
hmr: An hausaknahai chu mi var ta ding chun an lallukhum a na, Invêthai invêtna ruok chu invêtna ringawt el a nih.

en: A true witness delivereth souls; But he that uttereth lies causeth deceit.
hmr: Thuhretu indik chun mihai a sansuok hlak a, Thukhêl sâksuoktu ruok chun inhlêmna ân umtir.

en: In the fear of Jehovah is strong confidence; And his children shall have a place of refuge.
hmr: LALPA ṭinaa hin ringna nghettak a um a, A thlahai chun inhumhimna hmun nei an tih.

en: The fear of Jehovah is a fountain of life, That one may depart from the snares of death.
hmr: LALPA ṭina chu hringna tuikhur a na, Thina chânghaia inthawka pêt hmangna leh.

en: In the multitude of people is the king’s glory; But in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
hmr: Mipuihai pungkhâwmnaa chun lal ropuina chu a um a, Mipui tlâksamnaa ruok chun lal nau sietna chu a um thung.

en: He that is slow to anger is of great understanding; But he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
hmr: Mi lunginsen intaktak chu hrietthiemna nasatak nei a nih, Lungril ṭuonrang ruok chun invêtna chu a chawimawi a nih.

en: A tranquil heart is the life of the flesh; But envy is the rottenness of the bones.
hmr: Lungril hrisêl chu taksa hringna a na, Itthîkna ruok hi chu ruhai ta dinga hmawnna a nih.

en: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker; But he that hath mercy on the needy honoreth him.
hmr: Mi pasie nêksâwrtu chun ama Siemtu a hmusit a nih, Tlasam chunga lunginsietna nei ruok chun ama ân za a nih.

en: The wicked is thrust down in his evil-doing; But the righteous hath a refuge in his death.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu a thilthaw ri- loa chun sukthlûkin a um a, Mi fel ruok chun a thinaa chun beiseina a nei hlak.

en: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding; But that which is in the inward part of fools is made known.
hmr: Varna chu mi hrietthiemna neitu lungrila chun a chêng a, Invêthai lungrila um ruok chu ân hrietsa zing a nih.

en: Righteousness exalteth a nation; But sin is a reproach to any people.
hmr: Felna hin hnam a chawimawi a, Suolna ruok hi chu mi tukhawm ta dinga hmusitumna a nih.

en: The king’s favor is toward a servant that dealeth wisely; But his wrath will be against him that causeth shame.
hmr: Siehlaw vartaka thawtu chunga chun lal ditsakna chu a um a, Ama sukzaktu chunga ruok chun a lunginsenna um a tih.

en: A soft answer turneth away wrath; But a grievous word stirreth up anger.
hmr: Dawnna innêm chun lungin- senna a hnawt hmang a, Ṭawng theidaum ruok chun lunginsenna a chawktho.

en: The tongue of the wise uttereth knowledge aright; But the mouth of fools poureth out folly.
hmr: Mi var lei chun hrietna indik a hril suok hlak a, Mi invêt bau ruok chun invêtna a bun suok hlak.

en: The eyes of Jehovah are in every place, Keeping watch upon the evil and the good.
hmr: LALPA mithai chu hmun tinah a um a, Thil ṭha le thil ṭha naw chu a hmu zing hlak.

en: A gentle tongue is a tree of life; But perverseness therein is a breaking of the spirit.
hmr: Lei hrisêl chu hringna thing a na, Chutaka khêlthu ruok chu lungril kawidarna a nih.

en: A fool despiseth his father’s correction; But he that regardeth reproof getteth prudence.
hmr: Mi invêt chun a pa inchûktirna chu a hmusit a, Kâwkna ngaisaktu ruok chun varna a chang hlak.

en: In the house of the righteous is much treasure; But in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.
hmr: Mi fel ina chun ro tamtak a um a, Mi khawhlo hlâwknaa ruok chun buoina a um.

en: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge; But the heart of the foolish doeth not so.
hmr: Mi var hmûrhai chun hrietna a the dar a, Invêt lungril ruok chun chuong angin a thaw ve nawh.

en: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah; But the prayer of the upright is his delight.
hmr: Mi khawhlo inthawina chu LALPA ta dingin tirdakum a na, Mi tluong ṭawngṭâina ruok chu a lâwm zâwng a nih.

en: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah; But he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
hmr: Mi khawhlo lampui chu LALPA ta dingin tirdakum a na, Felna hnawttu ruok chu a hmangai hlak.

en: There is grievous correction for him that forsaketh the way; And he that hateth reproof shall die.
hmr: Lampui mâksantu ta ding chun sukdikna lungngaiumtak a um hlak, Kâwkna theidatu chu thi ngei a tih.

en: Sheol and Abaddon are before Jehovah; How much more then the hearts of the children of men!
hmr: Seol le Abaddon hman LALPA hmaa chun an um a, Mihriem nauhai lungrilhai chu a va um nasa âwm deh e!

en: A scoffer loveth not to be reproved; He will not go unto the wise.
hmr: Hmusittu chun kâwka um chu a ngaina nawh a, Mi var kuoma khawm fe ngai bawk naw nih.

en: A glad heart maketh a cheerful countenance; But by sorrow of heart the spirit is broken.
hmr: Lungril hlim chun hmêl hlimtak a siem a, Lungril lungngai ruok chun lungvar a suksiet hlak.

en: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge; But the mouth of fools feedeth on folly.
hmr: Mi hrietthiemna neitu lungril chun hrietna a zawng hlak a, Invêthai bau ruok chu invêtnain ân châwm.

en: All the days of the afflicted are evil; But he that is of a cheerful heart hath a continual feast.
hmr: Sukrinuma umhai nihai po po chu ni rilo an na, Lungril lâwmtak mi ruok chun ruoiṭhe zing zingna a nei.

en: Better is little, with the fear of Jehovah, Than great treasure and trouble therewith.
hmr: Hausakna nasatak, buoipuiumtak nêkin, LALPA ṭina le tlâwmte nei a ṭha lem.

en: Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is, Than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
hmr: Bâwngchal châwm thau buthlêng chutaka intheidana umna nêkin. Thlaihna buthlêng chutaka hmangaina umna chu a ṭha lem.

en: A wrathful man stirreth up contention; But he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
hmr: Mi nunsie chun inhalna a chawktho a, Mi lunginsen intak ruok chun inhalna a sukre.

en: The way of the sluggard is as a hedge of thorns; But the path of the upright is made a highway.
hmr: Mi thabo lampui chu hling daihai ang a na, Mi tluong lampui ruok chu lamtluongpui a nih.

en: A wise son maketh a glad father; But a foolish man despiseth his mother.
hmr: Naupa var chun pa lâwm a siem a, Mi invêt ruok chun a nu chu a hmusit.

en: Folly is joy to him that is void of wisdom; But a man of understanding maketh straight his going.
hmr: Mi lungril bo ta ding chun invêtna hi hlimum a na, Mi hrietthiemna nei mi ruok chun a fena chu a suktlûn hlak.

en: Where there is no counsel, purposes are disappointed; But in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
hmr: Inrâwnna um nawnaa chu thiltumhai chu a hlawsam hlak a, Amiruokchu, thurâwntuhai inkhâwm laia chun tungding an nih.

en: A man hath joy in the answer of his mouth; And a word in due season, how good is it!
hmr: Dawnna indik chun mi a suklâwm a, A huntaka thu a ni tak hril chu a va ṭha de!

en: To the wise the way of life goeth upward, That he may depart from Sheol beneath.
hmr: Mi var lampui chu hringnaah a tungin a kai, Hnuoi tienga Seol chu a mâksan theina dingin.

en: Jehovah will root up the house of the proud; But he will establish the border of the widow.
hmr: Mi chapo sûngkuo chu LALPA chun kar thlûng a ta, Hmeithai ramri ruok chu tungdingpêk a tih.

en: Evil devices are an abomination to Jehovah; But pleasant words are pure.
hmr: Remruotna rilohai hi LALPA ta dingin tirdakum a na, Thu lâwmumhai ruok chu ân thieng.

en: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; But he that hateth bribes shall live.
hmr: Hlêpnaa duâm mi chun a insûng a chawkbuoi a, Thamna theidatu ruok chu hring a tih.

en: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer; But the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
hmr: Mi fel lungril chun dawn dân ding ân chûk hlak a, Mi khawhlo bau ruok chun thil ṭhalohai a sâksuok hlak.

en: Jehovah is far from the wicked; But he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
hmr: Mi khawhloa inthawkin LALPA chu a hla a, Mi fel ṭawngṭâina ruok chu a hriet hlak.

en: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart; And good tidings make the bones fat.
hmr: Mithai varna chun lungril a suklâwm a, Chanchin ṭhahai chun ruhai a suktlawr.

en: The ear that hearkeneth to the reproof of life Shall abide among the wise.
hmr: Hringna sukdikna ngaithlâkna neitu chu, Mi var lai chun chêng a tih.

en: He that refuseth correction despiseth his own soul; But he that hearkeneth to reproof getteth understanding.
hmr: Inchûktirna sêlkaltu chun ama lungril ngei kha a hmusit a nih; Amiruokchu, kâwkna ngaitu chun hrietthiemna a nei hlak.

en: The fear of Jehovah is the instruction of wisdom; And before honor goeth humility.
hmr: LALPA ṭîna chu varna inchûktirna a nih; Chun, inzakaina hmaa chun inngaitlâwmna a fezie.

en: The plans of the heart belong to man; But the answer of the tongue is from Jehovah.
hmr: Lungril siemrêlnahai chu mihriem ta a na, Leia dawnna ruok chu LALPA kuoma inthawk a nih.

en: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; But Jehovah weigheth the spirits.
hmr: Mihriem lampuihai po po chu ama mithmuahai chun ân thieng a, LALPA ruok chun lungrilhai chu ân khi hlak.

en: Commit thy works unto Jehovah, And thy purposes shall be established.
hmr: I sinthawhai chu LALPA kuomah inkawltir la, I ngaituohai chu sukdet nîng a tih.

en: Jehovah hath made everything for its own end; Yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
hmr: LALPA chun thil tinrêng hi san nei sengin a siem a, Anih, mi khawhlo ngei khawm chu ni ṭha nawa dingin.

en: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to Jehovah: Though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
hmr: Lungrila chapo taphawt chu LALPA ta dingin tirdakum a nih, Ama chu hrem naw ni naw nih.

en: By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for; And by the fear of Jehovah men depart from evil.
hmr: Zângaina le thutak chun khawhlona chu sâwpfai a na, LALPA ṭina leiin mihaiin suolna an zâmsan.

en: When a man’s ways please Jehovah, He maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
hmr: Mi a um dânin LALPA a suklawm chun, A hmêlmahai ngei khawm ama le inrem dingin a siem.

en: Better is a little, with righteousness, Than great revenues with injustice.
hmr: Indiklona leia hlâwkna nasatakhai nêkin, Felna leia tlâwmte chu a ṭha lem.

en: A man’s heart deviseth his way; But Jehovah directeth his steps.
hmr: Mihriem lungril chun a lampui chu a riruong hlak a, A kalchawihai ruok chu LALPA chun a kâwkhmu hlak.

en: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king; His mouth shall not transgress in judgment.
hmr: Lal hmûrhaia chun vân tieng thusukthlûk chu a um a, Rorêlnaah a bau chun bawse ngai naw nih.

en: A just balance and scales are Jehovah’s; All the weights of the bag are his work.
hmr: Inkhina le bûkna indikhai chu LALPA ta a na, Ip riknahai po po khawm chu ama sinthaw a nih.

en: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness; For the throne is established by righteousness.
hmr: Khawhlona thaw chu lalhai ta dingin tirdakum a nih, Lalṭhungpha chu felnaa tungding a ni sih a.

en: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; And they love him that speaketh right.
hmr: Hmûr felhai chu lalhai lâwm zâwng a na, Thudik hriltu chun an ngaina hlak.

en: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death; But a wise man will pacify it.
hmr: Lal lunginsenna chu thina thangkohai an nih; Mi var ruok chun sukdei a tih.

en: In the light of the king’s countenance is life; And his favor is as a cloud of the latter rain.
hmr: Lal hmêl vara chun hringna a um a, A ditsakna chu ruo nuhnung sûm ang a nih.

en: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! Yea, to get understanding is rather to be chosen than silver.
hmr: Varna nei hi rângkachak nêka ieng ang khieua ṭha lem am a na! Anih, hrietthiemna nei hi tangka nêka thlang lem ding a nih.

en: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: He that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
hmr: Mi tluong lamtluongpui chu rîtlonaa inthawka fe hmang hi a na; Mi a lampui vêng ṭhatu chun a lungril chu a vawng ṭha.

en: Pride goeth before destruction, And a haughty spirit before a fall.
hmr: Chapona hi sietna hmaah a fe hlak a; Chun, lungril uong chu tlûkna hmaah.

en: Better it is to be of a lowly spirit with the poor, Than to divide the spoil with the proud.
hmr: Mi chapohai le râllâk sum insem nêk chun, Mi inngaitlâwmhai le lungril inhnuoitaka um a ṭha lem.

en: He that giveth heed unto the word shall find good; And whoso trusteth in Jehovah, happy is he.
hmr: Thu pawisatu chun thil ṭha hmûng a ta, LALPA ringtu chu, ama chu a hlim a nih.

en: The wise in heart shall be called prudent; And the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
hmr: Lungrila var chu mi var ti nîng a ta, Hmûrhai thlumna chun thiemna chu a sukpung.

en: Understanding is a well-spring of life unto him that hath it; But the correction of fools is their folly.
hmr: Hrietthiemna hi a neitu ta ding chun hringna tuihnâr a na; Invêthai inchûktirna ruok chu an invêtna a nih.

en: The heart of the wise instructeth his mouth, And addeth learning to his lips.
hmr: Mi var lungril chun ama bau ân chûktir a; A hmûrhaia chun thiemna a belsapêk hlak.

en: Pleasant words are as a honeycomb, Sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
hmr: Thu lâwmumhai chu khuoithlâr ang a na, Lungril ta dingin a thlum a, ruhai ta dingin hrisêlna a nih.

en: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, But the end thereof are the ways of death.
hmr: Mihriem kuoma indik âwmtaka inlang lampui chu a um a, Chu tâwpna ruok chu thina lampuihai a nih.

en: The appetite of the laboring man laboreth for him; For his mouth urgeth him thereto.
hmr: Mi sininrim phîngṭâmna chun ama ta dingin sin a thawh a, A bau chun ama chu a tirlui sih a.

en: A worthless man deviseth mischief; And in his lips there is as a scorching fire.
hmr: Mi hmangnabo chun pawitâwkna a rawtdawk a, A hmûrhaia chun mei em kâng thei ang chu a um a nih.

en: A perverse man scattereth abroad strife; And a whisperer separateth chief friends.
hmr: Mi dukindaklo chun inhalna a thedar a, Mi lâwtthiem chun ṭhien bulhai a sukṭhe.

en: A man of violence enticeth his neighbor, And leadeth him in a way that is not good.
hmr: Mi hrângsie chun a tuolbâwm chu a vethlêm a, Lampui ṭhaloa chun ama a ṭhuoi hlak.

en: He that shutteth his eyes, it is to devise perverse things: He that compresseth his lips bringeth evil to pass.
hmr: Mithai insîmtu chun thil ṭha naw a remruot a, Hmûr inchîp tlattu chun thil suol chu ân tlungtir hlak.

en: The hoary head is a crown of glory; It shall be found in the way of righteousness.
hmr: Lu inṭuok chu ropuina lallukhum a na, Mi fel lampuia chun hmu nîng a tih.

en: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; And he that ruleth his spirit, than he that taketh a city.
hmr: Mi lunginsen intaktak chu mi thilthawtheitak nêkin a ṭha lem a, A lungril thunun theitu chu khawpui latu nêkin a ṭha lem.

en: The lot is cast into the lap; But the whole disposing thereof is of Jehovah.
hmr: Ai chu mal chunga sân a ni hlak a, Thutlûkna ruok chu LALPA ta vawng a nih.

en: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, Than a house full of feasting with strife.
hmr: Inhal puma ruoiṭhe rawpna insûng nêk chun, Lungdamtaka bu bâr khat fâkna a ṭha lem.

en: A servant that dealeth wisely shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, And shall have part in the inheritance among the brethren.
hmr: Siehlaw vartaka thaw hlaktu chun naupa, inzakna intlun hlaktu, chunga chun rorêl a tih. Unauhai laiah rochan nei bawk a tih.

en: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; But Jehovah trieth the hearts.
hmr: Rawtuina bêl chu tangkaruo ta ding a na, pûm mei chu rângkachak ta ding a nih, LALPA ruok chun lungril a fie hlak.

en: An evil-doer giveth heed to wicked lips; And a liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue.
hmr: Thil suol thawtu chun hmûr khawhlohai chu a ngaisak a, Chun mi khêlinhlip chun lei pawitâwk tieng chun na a sit.

en: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker; And he that is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.
hmr: Tukhawm mi pasie nuisan chun a siemtu a hmusit a nih. Vângduoina diriemtu chu hrem lo ni naw nih.

en: Children’s children are the crown of old men; And the glory of children are their fathers.
hmr: Nauhai nauhai chu mi upahai lallukhum an na, Chun, nauhai ropuina chu an pahai chu an nih.

en: Excellent speech becometh not a fool; Much less do lying lips a prince.
hmr: Thuhril ṭhatak le invêt ân mawi ngai nawh a, Hmûr khêlinhlip chu lal nau leh ân mawi naw nâwk zuol.

en: A bribe is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it; Whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
hmr: Thamna hi a neitu ta ding chun mithaia lung hlutak ang a na, Ân her vêlna taphawta chun a hlawtling hlak.

en: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; But he that harpeth on a matter separateth chief friends.
hmr: Bawsietna inkhumtu chun hmangaina a zawng a, Thil hril hriltu ruok chun ṭhien bul a ṭhe.

en: A rebuke entereth deeper into one that hath understanding Than a hundred stripes into a fool.
hmr: Kâwkna hi hrietna nei mia chun a lût thûk lem, Invêt vawi za khat vuok nêk hmanin.

en: An evil man seeketh only rebellion; Therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
hmr: Mi rilo chun hêlna chau a zawng a, Chuleiin, ama kuoma chun mitir nunsetak tir nîng a tih.

en: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, Rather than a fool in his folly.
hmr: Invêt ân vêt laia intuokpui nêk chun, Savawmpui a tehai inrûkpêka um intuokpui nuom a um lem.

en: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, Evil shall not depart from his house.
hmr: Tukhawm thil ṭha aia thil ṭha naw pe lem chu, Thil ṭha naw a ina inthawkin fe hmang ngai naw nih.

en: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: Therefore leave off contention, before there is quarrelling.
hmr: Insuolna hung inṭan dân hi miin tui a hersuok ang chau a nih, Chuleiin, inhalna chu insuolna a um hmain mâksan rawh.

en: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, Both of them alike are an abomination to Jehovah.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu thiem inchangtir a, mi fel chu thiemnaw inchangtir chu, Chu ve vehai chu angkhata LALPA ta dinga tirdakum a nih.

en: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, Seeing he hath no understanding?
hmr: Hrietthiemna a nei naw chun, Varna inchâwkna man ding invêt kuta chun ieng dingin am um a ta?

en: A friend loveth at all times; And a brother is born for adversity.
hmr: Ṭhien chun ieng lai khawmin a hmangai a, Unau chu lunginzîng ni dinga pieng a nih.

en: A man void of understanding striketh hands, And becometh surety in the presence of his neighbor.
hmr: Mi hrietthiemna nei lo chun a kuthai a ben a, A tuolbâwm hmaihmaa chun mawphurtu a hung ni hlak.

en: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: He that raiseth high his gate seeketh destruction.
hmr: Bawsietna ngainatu chun inhalna khawm a ngaina a, A dâi kawtkhâr dawm sângtu chun sietna a zawng a nih.

en: He that hath a wayward heart findeth no good; And he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
hmr: Lungril chapo neitu chun thil ṭha a hmu ngai nawh a, Lei khêlinhlip neitu chu pawitâwknaah a tlu lût hlak.

en: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow; And the father of a fool hath no joy.
hmr: Nau invêt neitu chun a lungngaina chau dinga nei a na, Chun, invêt pa chun hlimna a nei bawk nawh.

en: A cheerful heart is a good medicine; But a broken spirit drieth up the bones.
hmr: Lungril hlim chu damdawi ṭha a na, Lungril serawp ruok chun ruhai a sukṭâwl.

en: A wicked man receiveth a bribe out of the bosom, To pervert the ways of justice.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chun ângsûnga inthawkin thilthlâwnpêk chu a lâk a, Rorêlna lampuihai chu a sukkâwi hlak.

en: Wisdom is before the face of him that hath understanding; But the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
hmr: Varna chu hrietthiemna neitu hmaihmaa chun a um a, Invêt mithai ruok chu leihnuoi tâwpa chun an um.

en: A foolish son is a grief to his father, And bitterness to her that bare him.
hmr: Naupa invêt chu a pa ta dinga lunginrimna a na, A neitu nu ta ding chun rimsikna a nih.

en: Also to punish the righteous is not good, Nor to smite the noble for their uprightness.
hmr: Mi fel inchawitir chu a ṭha nawh a, Mi ṭha an tluongna leia vuok khawm chu a ṭha chuong nawh.

en: He that spareth his words hath knowledge; And he that is of a cool spirit is a man of understanding.
hmr: A thuhai hla tâwk nei mi chun hrietthiemna a nei a, Lungril dei nei mi chu hrietthiemna nei mi a nih.

en: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise; When he shutteth his lips, he is esteemed as prudent.
hmr: Invêt khawm, a to ṭawk lai chun mi vara ngai a na, A hmûrhai ân chip tlat lai chun mi var anga ngai a nih.

en: He that separateth himself seeketh his own desire, And rageth against all sound wisdom.
hmr: Mi mâni insuktum chun, mâni nuom zâwng ngei chu a zawng a, Varna indik po po a sêlkal hlak.

en: A fool hath no delight in understanding, But only that his heart may reveal itself.
hmr: Invêt chun hrietthiemnaa chun lâwmna a nei nawh a, A lungrila ama le ama ân hmu suok theina chaua naw khan chu.

en: When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt, And with ignominy cometh reproach.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu a hung pha chun hmusitna khawm a hung veh a, Tlâng ihrilsiet nina le chun kâwkna a hung bawk.

en: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters; The wellspring of wisdom is as a flowing brook.
hmr: Mihriem baua thuhai chu tui inthûkhai ang a na, Varna tuihnâr chu vadungtê luonglai ang a nih.

en: To respect the person of the wicked is not good, Nor to turn aside the righteous in judgment.
hmr: Mi khawhlo ditsak chu thil ṭha a ni nawh a, Rorêlnaa mi fel hnâwlhmang chu a ṭha chuong bawk nawh.

en: A fool’s lips enter into contention, And his mouth calleth for stripes.
hmr: Mi invêt hmûrhai chun inhalna ân tlun a, A bau chun vuoknahai a ko bawk.

en: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, And his lips are the snare of his soul.
hmr: Mi invêt bau chu ama sietna a na, A hmûrhai chu a lungril ta dinga châng a nih.

en: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, And they go down into the innermost parts.
hmr: Mi lâwtthiem thuhai chu bubâr tuihnâitak ang an na, Phîng sûng hmun inthûktakhaiah an fe thla hlak.

en: He also that is slack in his work Is brother to him that is a destroyer.
hmr: Ama sinthawa inthlada mi chu Suksetu unaupa chu a nih.

en: The name of Jehovah is a strong tower; The righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
hmr: LALPA hming chu kulbîng dettak a na, Mi fel chu chutaka chun a tlân lût a, a him hlak.

en: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, And as a high wall in his own imagination.
hmr: Mi hausa hausakna chu a khawpui dettak a na, Ama ngairuotnahaia ngei chun bang insâng ang a nih.

en: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty; And before honor goeth humility.
hmr: Sietna hmaah mihriem lungril chu a uong hlak a, Inzâkaina hmaa chun inngaitlâwmna a fe zie.

en: He that giveth answer before he heareth, It is folly and shame unto him.
hmr: A hriet hmaa dawnna petu chu, A ta dingin inzakum le invêtna a nih.

en: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; But a broken spirit who can bear?
hmr: Mihriem lungril chun a hrât nawna chu chelngîr a ta, Lungril kawise ruok chu tuin am tuor thei a ta?

en: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; And the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
hmr: Mi var lungril chun hrietna a nei a, Mi var na chun thiemna a zawng bawk.

en: A man’s gift maketh room for him, And bringeth him before great men.
hmr: Mihriem thilthlâwnpêk chun ama ta dingin hmun a siempêk a, Ama chu mi ropuihai hmaah a hung ṭhuoi hlak.

en: He that pleadeth his cause first seemeth just; But his neighbor cometh and searcheth him out.
hmr: Ama chungthu hril hmasatu chu indik âwmin ân lang a, Nisienlakhawm, a tuolbâwm chu a hung a, a hung phawr lang hlak.

en: The lot causeth contentions to cease, And parteth between the mighty.
hmr: Aisânna chun insêlnahai a sukbo a, Mi hrâthai chu a sukṭhe bawk.

en: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city; And such contentions are like the bars of a castle.
hmr: Unaupa suklungawiloa um chu khawpui dettak nêkin hne ân tak lem, Chuong inhalnahai chu kula thîrtluonhai ang a nih.

en: A man’s belly shall be filled with the fruit of his mouth; With the increase of his lips shall he be satisfied.
hmr: Mihriem phîng chu a baua rasuok chun suksip nîng a ta, A hmûrhaia hlawkna chun ama chu suklungawi ning a tih.

en: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; And they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
hmr: Thina le hringna hi lei thilthawtheinaa um an na, Achu hmangaitu chun chutaka inthawka ra chu fâng a tih.

en: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, And obtaineth favor of Jehovah.
hmr: Tukhawm nuhmei hmutu chun thil ṭha a hmu a nih, LALPA ditsakna khawm a chang a nih.

en: The poor useth entreaties; But the rich answereth roughly.
hmr: Mi pasie chun ngênna thuhai a hmang hlak a, Mi hausa ruok chun tlahawltakin a dawn hlak.

en: He that maketh many friends doeth it to his own destruction; But there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
hmr: Ruolhai tamtak siemtu chun ama sietna ding el a thaw a nih, Amiruokchu, ruol unau nêka hnai lema kawp tlat chu a um a nih.

en: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity Than he that is perverse in his lips and is a fool.
hmr: Mi pasie lungril ṭhaa fetu chu, A hmûrhaia khêlinhlipa mi invêt nêk chun a ṭha lem.

en: Also, that the soul be without knowledge is not good; And he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
hmr: Lungril hrietthiemna bo khawm chu a ṭha chuong nawh a, Chun, a kehai tir inhmâwtu chun a suksuol hlak.

en: The foolishness of man subverteth his way; And his heart fretteth against Jehovah.
hmr: Mihriem invêtna chun a lampui chu a sukkâwi a, A lungril chu LALPA chungah a lungsen hlak.

en: Wealth addeth many friends; But the poor is separated from his friend.
hmr: Hausakna chun ruolhai tamtak a belsa a, Mi pasie ruok chu a ruola inthawka ṭhein a um.

en: A false witness shall not be unpunished; And he that uttereth lies shall not escape.
hmr: Thuhretu indik naw chu hrem lo ni naw ni a, Thukhêl sâksuoktu chun pumpel bawk naw nih.

en: Many will entreat the favor of the liberal man; And every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
hmr: Mi tamtakin mi tiktlai ditsakna an ngên a, Mi tin chu thilthlâwnpêk petu ta dinga ruol a nih.

en: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: How much more do his friends go far from him! He pursueth them with words, but they are gone.
hmr: Mi pasie chu a unauhai po poin an theida a, A ruolhai lem chun ieng ang khieua hla am an fe san ding chu! Thuhaiin anni a hnawt pei a; nisienlakhawm, an fe hmang tah.

en: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: He that keepeth understanding shall find good.
hmr: Varna hmutu chun ama lungril a hmangai a, Hrietthiemna vawngtu chun thil ṭha chu hmûng a tih.

en: A false witness shall not be unpunished; And he that uttereth lies shall perish.
hmr: Thuhretu indik naw chu hrem lo ni naw nih, Thukhêl sâksuoktu chu bohmang bawk a tih.

en: Delicate living is not seemly for a fool; Much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
hmr: Inhawi chên hi invêt ta ding chun a âwm nawh a, Siehlaw ta dingin lal nauhai chunga rorêl chu a âwm naw nâwk zuol a nih.

en: The discretion of a man maketh him slow to anger; And it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
hmr: Mihriem remruotthiemna hin ama chu lunginsen intak dingin a siem a, Bawsietna fe khêl chu ama ta dingin chawimawina a nih.

en: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; But his favor is as dew upon the grass.
hmr: Lal lunginsenna chu sakeibak- nei inrûm ri ang a na, A ditsakna ruok chu hlohna chunga daidaw ang a nih.

en: A foolish son is the calamity of his father; And the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
hmr: Naupa invêt chu a pa lunginrimna a na, Nuhmei lungawinawna chu ruo sûr zing ang a nih.

en: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers; But a prudent wife is from Jehovah.
hmr: In le hausaknahai hi thlatu- haia inthawka rochan an na, Nuhmei var ruok hi chu LALPAA inthawk a nih.

en: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; And the idle soul shall suffer hunger.
hmr: Thabona chu imu inhniktakah ân peilût a, Mi thabo chun phîngṭâm tuor a tih.

en: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul; But he that is careless of his ways shall die.
hmr: Thupêk vawngtu chun a lung- ril chu a vawng ṭha a na, A lampuihaia fîmkhur lo chu thîng a tih.

en: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto Jehovah, And his good deed will he pay him again.
hmr: Mi pasie lunginsiettu chun LALPA ân pûktir a na, A thil thaw ṭha chu ama chun pe nâwk a tih.

en: Chasten thy son, seeing there is hope; And set not thy heart on his destruction.
hmr: Beiseina a la um laiin i naupa chu thunun la, A sietna ding êm chun lungril nei naw rawh.

en: A man of great wrath shall bear the penalty; For if thou deliver him, thou must do it yet again.
hmr: Mi lunginsen êm êm mi chun hremna chu tuor a ta, Ama chu i sansuok chun, i sansuok nâwk pei a ṭûl ding a ni sih a.

en: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, That thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
hmr: Thurâwn chu ngai la, inchûktirna chu pawm rawh, I hihnung tâwp tienga i hung var theina dingin.

en: There are many devices in a man’s heart; But the counsel of Jehovah, that shall stand.
hmr: Mihriem lungrila chun remruotna tamtak a um a, Amiruokchu, LALPA thurâwn chau chu ngîrsuok a tih.

en: That which maketh a man to be desired is his kindness; And a poor man is better than a liar.
hmr: Mihriem nuom zâwng chu a lunginsietna inkhina a na, Mi pasie chu mi khêlhlip nêkin a ṭha lem.

en: The fear of Jehovah tendeth to life; And he that hath it shall abide satisfied; He shall not be visited with evil.
hmr: LALPA ṭîna chun hringna ân tlun a, Chu chu neitu chu tlaitakin um a ta, Thil ṭha naw hrimin ama chu sir ngai naw nih.

en: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, And will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
hmr: Mi thabo chun thlênga chun a kut chu a phûm a, A baua hang thun takngiel khawm chu a pei nawh.

en: Smite a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; And reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
hmr: Hmusittu chu vaw la, mi mâwl chun var inchûk a tih, Hrietthiemna nei mi chu kâwk la, hrethiem a tih.

en: He that doeth violence to his father, and chaseth away his mother, Is a son that causeth shame and bringeth reproach.
hmr: A pa suksetu chun a nu chu a hnawt hmang a na, Ama chu kâwkna le inzakna intlungtir hlaktu naupa chu a nih.

en: Cease, my son, to hear instruction Only to err from the words of knowledge.
hmr: Ka naupa, hrietthiemna thuhaia inthawka pêthmangna ding chau a, Inchûktirnahai ngaithlâk hi tâwp san rawh.

en: A worthless witness mocketh at justice; And the mouth of the wicked swalloweth iniquity.
hmr: Thuhretu hmangnabo chun rorêlna a nuisan a, Mi khawhlo bau chun suolna a lem.

en: Judgments are prepared for scoffers, And stripes for the back of fools.
hmr: Rorêlnahai hi hmusittuhai ta dinga buotsai an na, Vuoknahai hi invêt ruongzâng ta dingin.

en: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, And lay up my commandments with thee;
hmr: Ka naupa, ka thuhai hi i pawm a, Nangmaa ka thupêkhai hi i siekhâwl a,

en: So as to incline thine ear unto wisdom, And apply thy heart to understanding;
hmr: Chuonga varna tienga i na chu i sit a, Hrietthiemna tienga i lungril chu i hmang chun;

en: Yea, if thou cry after discernment, And lift up thy voice for understanding;
hmr: Anih, ngairuotdikna chu i ko a, Hrietthiemna koa i râwl în suo bawk a,

en: If thou seek her as silver, And search for her as for hid treasures:
hmr: Tangka anga i zawng a, Ro phûm rûkhai anga i zawng suok chun;

en: Then shalt thou understand the fear of Jehovah, And find the knowledge of God.
hmr: LALPA ṭitna chu hung hre tâng i ta, Pathien hrietna chu hmu suok tâng i tih.

en: For Jehovah giveth wisdom; Out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding:
hmr: LALPA chun varna a pêk sih a; A baua inthawk chun hrietna le hrietthiemna hung suok a tih.

en: He layeth up sound wisdom for the upright; He is a shield to them that walk in integrity;
hmr: Mi tluong ta ding chun varna hrisêl chu a siekhâwl a; Lungril ṭhataka fetuhai ta ding chun phaw a nih.

en: That he may guard the paths of justice, And preserve the way of his saints.
hmr: Rorêlna lampuihai chu a vênghim theina ding le, A mi inthienghai lampui chu a vawngṭhatna dingin.

en: Then shalt thou understand righteousness and justice, And equity, yea, every good path.
hmr: Chun, rorêlna le felna chu hung hrethiem tâng i ta, Thlierbîk nei nawna chu, anih, lampui ṭha tinrêng el le chun.

en: For wisdom shall enter into thy heart, And knowledge shall be pleasant unto thy soul;
hmr: Varna chu i lungrila chun hung lût a ta, I hringna ta ding chun hrietna chu inhawitina nîng a tih.

en: Discretion shall watch over thee; Understanding shall keep thee:
hmr: Ngairuot thiemna chun nangma chu vêng a ti cheh a, Hrietthiemna chun kawl tlat a ti che;

en: To deliver thee from the way of evil, From the men that speak perverse things;
hmr: Mi rilo lampuia inthawka sansuok ding che le, Thil khawhlohai hriltuhaia inthawka sansuok ding chein;

en: Who forsake the paths of uprightness, To walk in the ways of darkness;
hmr: Inthimna lampui hraw dinga, Felna lampuihai nghatsantuhaia inthawk le,

en: Who rejoice to do evil, And delight in the perverseness of evil;
hmr: Rîtlona thaw kawnga hlimtuhai, Mi rilo khawhlonaa lâwm hlaktuhaia inthawk le,

en: Who are crooked in their ways, And wayward in their paths:
hmr: An lampuihaia mi kâwihai, An lampuihai pêtsantuhaia inthawkin.

en: To deliver thee from the strange woman, Even from the foreigner that flattereth with her words;
hmr: Hmêlmak nuhmeia inthawka sansuok ding chein, A bâuthluma zaihlêmtu che, ram dang mi ngeia inthawk chun;

en: That forsaketh the friend of her youth, And forgetteth the covenant of her God:
hmr: A tleirâwl lai ṭhien chu nghatsan a, A Pathien thuthlung theinghiltua inthawk chun.

en: For her house inclineth unto death, And her paths unto the dead;
hmr: A in chun thina chu ân nghâi zing a, A lampuihai chu thinaah:

en: None that go unto her return again, Neither do they attain unto the paths of life:
hmr: A mânu kuoma fetu chu tukhawm an hung kîr nâwk ta nawh a, Hringna lampuihai khawm chu an pâw phâk ngai bawk nawh;

en: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, And keep the paths of the righteous.
hmr: Mi ṭhahai lampui chu i hraw theina ding le, Mi fel lampuihai chu i hraw theina dingin.

en: For the upright shall dwell in the land, And the perfect shall remain in it.
hmr: Mi tluong chu rama chun chêng a ta, Mi ṭha famkim chu a um zing ding a ni sih a.

en: But the wicked shall be cut off from the land, And the treacherous shall be rooted out of it.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi khawhlo chu rama inthawka sât thlâk nîng a ta, Bawsetuhai chu amaa inthawk chun zunga phawi hmangin um an tih.

en: Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler; And whosoever erreth thereby is not wise.
hmr: Uoin hi nuisantu a na, zu hi mi risie a nih, Tukhawm chutaka suksuoltu chu a var naw a nih.

en: The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: He that provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own life.
hmr: Lal ṭiumna chu sakeibaknei inrûm ri ang a na, Ama suklungsentu chun ama hringna chunga ngei chun thil a suksuol a nih.

en: It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife; But every fool will be quarrelling.
hmr: Insuolnaa inthawka insietum hi mihriem ta dingin inzâkaina a na, Amiruokchu, invêt taphawthai chu insêl an tih.

en: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; Therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.
hmr: Mi thabo chun thlasik leiin hnuoi inlet naw nih a, Chuleiin, busîk pha chun kut dâwng a ta, iengkhawm nei naw nih.

en: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; But a man of understanding will draw it out.
hmr: Mihriem lungrila thurâwn hi tui inthûk ang a na, Amiruokchu, hrietthiemna nei mi chun chawi suok a tih.

en: Most men will proclaim every one his own kindness; But a faithful man who can find?
hmr: Mi tamtak chun mâni ṭhatna hril seng an ta, Mi ringum ruok chu tuin am hmu suok thei a ta?

en: A righteous man that walketh in his integrity, Blessed are his children after him.
hmr: Mi indik a lungril ṭhaa fe mi chu, Ama hnunga a thlahai chu an hamṭha.

en: A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment Scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
hmr: Rorêlna lalṭhungphaa lal ṭhung chun, A mithaiin thil ṭha naw po po a hnawt dar.

en: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
hmr: Tuin am, “Ka lungril chu ka sukthieng a, Ka suolnaa inthawkin kân thieng tah” ti thei a ta?

en: Diverse weights, and diverse measures, Both of them alike are an abomination to Jehovah.
hmr: Bûkna danglamhai, inkhîna danglamhai, Chuhai ve ve chu angkhata LALPA ta dinga tirdakum a nih.

en: Even a child maketh himself known by his doings, Whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
hmr: Naupang hmanin a thilthaw- haiin ama le ama ân suklang hlak, A sinthaw chu ân thieng amanih, ân dik amani khawm ni sien.

en: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Jehovah hath made even both of them.
hmr: Hrietna na le, hmuna mit chu, Chuhai ve ve chu LALPA siem an nih.

en: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; Open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
hmr: Zâl hmakhuo ngai naw ta, tlâksamnaah lût rawi i tih, I mithai chu meng la, chuong- chun, beia suktlai nîng i tih.

en: It is bad, it is bad, saith the buyer; But when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
hmr: “A ni nawh, a ni nawh” inchawtu chun a tih a, A fe hmang pha ruok chun a uong hlak.

en: There is gold, and abundance of rubies; But the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
hmr: Rângkachak le lung mantam tamtak a um a, Amiruokchu, hrietna hmûrhai chu lunghlu hlutak an nih.

en: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; And hold him in pledge that is surety for foreigners.
hmr: Hmêlmak mi ta dingin a aiaw dingin a silfên la la, Chun, nuhmei hmêlmak mi ta ding chun ama chu aiawah hrên rawh.

en: Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man; But afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
hmr: Indik nawna bei hi mihriem ta dingin a thlum a, A hnunga ruok chun a bau chu phaiphinin sip a tih.

en: Every purpose is established by counsel; And by wise guidance make thou war.
hmr: Thiltum tinrêng chu thurâwna tungding a na, Ṭhuoina var leh indona chu siem rawh.

en: He that goeth about as a tale-bearer revealeth secrets; Therefore company not with him that openeth wide his lips.
hmr: Mi bautam invâk vêltu chun thurûkhai a phuong a, Chuleiin, a bau ka lientu chu va pâwl naw rawh.

en: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, His lamp shall be put out in blackness of darkness.
hmr: Tukhawm a nu amanih, a pa amanih ṭawngse inphurtu chu, A khâwnvar chu inthim sâmup- na laia chun her hlum nîng a tih.

en: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; But the end thereof shall not be blessed.
hmr: A tira chun rochan chu inhmâwtaka chang thei nîng a ta, Amiruokchu, chu tâwpna chu malsâwmpêk ni naw nih.

en: Say not thou, I will recompense evil: Wait for Jehovah, and he will save thee.
hmr: “Thil ṭha naw chu thung ka tih,” nangin ti naw la, LALPA chu nghâk la, ama chun sandam a ti che.

en: Diverse weights are an abomination to Jehovah; And a false balance is not good.
hmr: Bûkna danglamhai chu LALPA ta dingin tirdakum a na, Bûkkhaina indik naw khawm chu a ṭha nawh.

en: A man’s goings are of Jehovah; How then can man understand his way?
hmr: Mihriem fenahai chu LALPA ta a na, Chuong a ni chun, miin iengtin am mâni lampui chu hre thei a ta?

en: It is a snare to a man rashly to say, It is holy, And after vows to make inquiry.
hmr: “ân thieng a nih,” hang ti thlâk rawk el hi mihriem ta dingin châng a na, Inkhâmnahai hnunga hrietchiengna siem le hin.

en: A wise king winnoweth the wicked, And bringeth the threshing-wheel over them.
hmr: Lal var chun mi khawhlohai chu a hnawt dar a, Bu chîlna tawlailîr kekuol chu an chungah a hung lâk.

en: The spirit of man is the lamp of Jehovah, Searching all his innermost parts.
hmr: Mihriem lungril chu Pathien khâwnvar a na, Phîngsûng hmun inthûktakhai po po chu a zawng suok hlak.

en: Kindness and truth preserve the king; And his throne is upholden by kindness.
hmr: Lunginsietna le thutak hin lal chu a vawngṭha a, A lalṭhungpha khawm chu zângainaa tungding a nih.

en: The glory of young men is their strength; And the beauty of old men is the hoary head.
hmr: Tlangvâlhai ropuina chu an hrâtna hi a na, Mi upahai mawina chu an lu inṭuok hi a nih.

en: Stripes that wound cleanse away evil; And strokes reach the innermost parts.
hmr: Hliem khawpa vuokna chun thil ṭha naw a sukfai a, Vuoknahai chun phing sûng sûngril hmunhai chu a sukfai.

en: The king’s heart is in the hand of Jehovah as the watercourses: He turneth it whithersoever he will.
hmr: Lal lungril chu tui luong ruomhai angin LALPA kuta chun a um a, Ama nuomna tieng tieng a hêm hlak.

en: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; But Jehovah weigheth the hearts.
hmr: Mihriem lampui tin el chu ama mithmua chun ân dik a, Amiruokchu, LALPA chun lungril chu ân khi hlak a nih.

en: To do righteousness and justice Is more acceptable to Jehovah than sacrifice.
hmr: Rorêlna le thil fel thaw hi, Inthâwina nêkin LALPA ta dingin pawmtlâk a ni lem dai.

en: A high look, and a proud heart, Even the lamp of the wicked, is sin.
hmr: Meng insâng le lungril chapo, Mi khawhlo khâwnvar ngei khawm chu suol a nih.

en: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; But every one that is hasty hasteth only to want.
hmr: Mi taima ngaituonahai chun hau hnawkna a âwn a, Amiruokchu, mi tin inhmaw ta hrim hrim chu tlasam ding chaua inhmaw a nih.

en: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue Is a vapor driven to and fro by them that seek death.
hmr: Lei khêlinhlip leia hausakna hmu chu, Hmatieng hnungtienga tuihu lên hmanga um ang chu a na, a zawngtuhai chun thina an zawng a nih.

en: The violence of the wicked shall sweep them away, Because they refuse to do justice.
hmr: Mi khawhlo hrângsietna chun anni chu hrût hmang a tih, Rorêlna indik thaw an nuom naw leiin.

en: The way of him that is laden with guilt is exceeding crooked; But as for the pure, his work is right.
hmr: Mi khawhlo lampui chu a kâwi hle a, Mi inthieng sinthaw ruok chu a tluong a nih.

en: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, Than with a contentious woman in a wide house.
hmr: Nuhmei hrângsie le in liena um nêk chun, Inchung sîp kilkhâwra chêng chu a ṭha lem.

en: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: His neighbor findeth no favor in his eyes.
hmr: Mi khawhlo lungril chun thil suol a châk a, A mithmua chun a tuolbâwm chun ditsakna hrim a hmu nawh.

en: When the scoffer is punished, the simple is made wise; And when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
hmr: Hmusittu chu hrem a ni pha chun, mi mâwl chu sukvar a na, Mi var chu inchûktir a ni pha chun, hrietna a hmu hlak.

en: The righteous man considereth the house of the wicked, How the wicked are overthrown to their ruin.
hmr: Mi fel chun mi khawhlo sûng- kuo chu a ngaituo hlak a; Iengtizieha mi khawhlohai chu an sietnaa pei thlâk am an niha ti hi.

en: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, He also shall cry, but shall not be heard.
hmr: Tukhawm mi pasie khêk ria a nahai suksêt chu, Ama khawm khêk ngei a ta, amiruokchu, ngai ni naw nih.

en: A gift in secret pacifieth anger; And a present in the bosom, strong wrath.
hmr: A rûka thilthlâwnpêk hin lunginsenna a sukre a, Ângsûnga thilpêk hin lungin- senna nasatak a sukre.

en: It is joy to the righteous to do justice; But it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
hmr: Rorêlna indik hi mi fel ta ding chun hlimum a na, Thil suol thawtuhai ta ding ruok chun sietna a nih.

en: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding Shall rest in the assembly of the dead.
hmr: Mi hrietthiemna lampuia inthawka invâkhmang chu Mithihai inkhâwmnaa chun châwl a tih.

en: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: He that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
hmr: Nuomsipna ngaina mi chu mi pasie nîng a ta, Uoin le hriek ngaina mi chu hausa ngai naw nih.

en: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; And the treacherous cometh in the stead of the upright.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu mi fel ta dinga intlanna a na, Bawsetu chu mi tluong aiawin a hung bawk.

en: It is better to dwell in a desert land, Than with a contentious and fretful woman.
hmr: Nuhmei awnazawng le hrângsie le um nêkin, Thlalêr rama um a ṭha lem.

en: There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; But a foolish man swalloweth it up.
hmr: Mi var chêngnaa chun hriek le hausakna hlutak chu a um a, Mi invêt ruok chun a lem zo hlak.

en: He that followeth after righteousness and kindness Findeth life, righteousness, and honor.
hmr: Zângaina le felna hnawttu chun, Hringna, felna le inzâkaina a hmu hlak.

en: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, And bringeth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
hmr: Mi var chun mi hrât khawpui chu ân khih a, Chutaka inringzona hrâtna chu a sukhnuoi hlak.

en: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue Keepeth his soul from troubles.
hmr: Tukhawm a lei le a bau vêng ṭha chun, Buoinahaia inthawkin a lungril chu a vêng ṭha a nih.

en: The proud and haughty man, scoffer is his name; He worketh in the arrogance of pride.
hmr: Mi chapo le mi uong chu a hming chu Hmusittu a na, Inphûloin chaponaah sin a thawh a.

en: The desire of the sluggard killeth him; For his hands refuse to labor.
hmr: Mi thabo nuom zâwng chun ama a that a, A kuthai chun sinthaw inrim a nuom nawh a.

en: There is that coveteth greedily all the day long; But the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.
hmr: Sûnnithlâk thlâk ela duâmtak- a inhnar hlak chu a um a, Mi fel ruok chun a pêk a, ân ro ngai nawh.

en: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; How much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind!
