hmr: Mi khawlo inthawina chu tirdakum a na, Lungril suola a hung lâk pha lem chun a va ni nasa âwm de!

en: A false witness shall perish; But the man that heareth shall speak so as to endure.
hmr: Thuhretu indik naw chu bohmang a ta, Thuhretu indik thu ruok chu sêldawng ni naw nih.

en: A wicked man hardeneth his face; But as for the upright, he establisheth his ways.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chun a hmai a sukngar a, Mi tluong ruok chun a lampuihai a rêl fel.

en: There is no wisdom nor understanding Nor counsel against Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA kal zâwnga thurâwn amanih, Hrietthiemna amanih, varna amani khawm a um nawh.

en: The horse is prepared against the day of battle; But victory is of Jehovah.
hmr: Sakawr chu indo nia ding chun buotsai a ni hlak a, Hnêna ruok chu LALPA ta a nih.

en: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, And loving favor rather than silver and gold.
hmr: Hausakna nasatakhai nêkin hming ṭha hi thlang lem ding a na, Ditsakna ngainatum chu tangka le rângkachak nêka thlang lem ding a nih.

en: The rich and the poor meet together: Jehovah is the maker of them all.
hmr: Mi hausa le mi pasie chu an intuok a, An rênga anni siemtu chu LALPA a nih.

en: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; But the simple pass on, and suffer for it.
hmr: Mi var chun thil suol chu a hmuh a, ân bih a, Mi mâwl ruok chu a fe pei a, a tuor pha hlak.

en: The reward of humility and the fear of Jehovah Is riches, and honor, and life.
hmr: Inngaitlâwmna lâwmman le LALPA ṭîna chu Hausaknahai le inzâkaina le hringna a nih.

en: Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse: He that keepeth his soul shall be far from them.
hmr: Mi dukdaklo lampuia chun hlinghai le chânghai an um a, A lungril vêng ṭhatu chu chuonga inthawka hlataka chun um a tih.

en: Train up a child in the way he should go, And even when he is old he will not depart from it.
hmr: Naupang chu a hraw ding lampuia chun inchûktir la, A hung upat hnung khawma chutaka inthawk chu pêt ngai naw nih.

en: The rich ruleth over the poor; And the borrower is servant to the lender.
hmr: Mi hausa chun mi pase chunga chun ro a rêl a, Thil pûktu chu ân pûktirtu siehlaw a nih.

en: He that soweth iniquity shall reap calamity; And the rod of his wrath shall fail.
hmr: Khawhlona thetu chun lunginzîngna sîk a ta, A lunginsenna hmawl chu hlawsam bawk a tih.

en: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; For he giveth of his bread to the poor.
hmr: Mi tiktlâi chu malsâwmin um a tih, Mi pase kuomah a bei chu a pêk sih a.

en: Cast out the scoffer, and contention will go out; Yea, strife and ignominy will cease.
hmr: Hmusittu chu hnawt suok la, inhalna khawm chu fe suok vêng a tih. Anih, insuolna le inhrilsietna khawm chu bo a tih.

en: He that loveth pureness of heart, For the grace of his lips the king will be his friend.
hmr: Lungril inthiengna ngainatu chu, A hmûrahai chun lunginsietna a nei a, lal chu ama ruolpa nîng a tih.

en: The eyes of Jehovah preserve him that hath knowledge; But he overthroweth the words of the treacherous man.
hmr: LALPA mithai chun mi hriet- na nei mi chu a vawng ṭha a, Mi ringum naw thuhai ruok chu a peithlâk.

en: The sluggard saith, There is a lion without; I shall be slain in the streets.
hmr: Mi thabo chun, “Tuola sawn sakeibaknei a um a, Kawtthlêrhaia sukhlum nîng ka tih,” a ta.

en: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit; He that is abhorred of Jehovah shall fall therein.
hmr: Hmêlmak nuhmei bau chu khur inthûktak a na, LALPAIN a chunga lunginsenna a nei chu chutaka chun tlâng a tih.

en: Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child; But the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
hmr: Invêtna hi naupang lungrila chun khuopdein a um a, Amiruokchu, sukdikna hmawl chun amaa inthawka hlatakah hnawthmang a tih.

en: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his gain, And he that giveth to the rich, shall come only to want.
hmr: A hlâwkna dinga mi pasie nêksâwr a, Mi hausa kuoma pe hlaktu chu a hung hlawsam tei hlak.

en: Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, And apply thy heart unto my knowledge.
hmr: I na sit la, mi var thuhai hi ngai rawh, Ka hrietnaa hin i lungril chu hmang bawk rawh.

en: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee, If they be established together upon thy lips.
hmr: Nangma sûnga i vawng ṭha chun thil inhawi a ni sih a, I hmûrhaia chun tungding an ni ve bawk chun.

en: That thy trust may be in Jehovah, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee.
hmr: I ringna chu LALPA a ni theina dingin, Hi ni hin i kuomah, i kuom ngeiah, kân hriettir che hi.

en: Have not I written unto thee excellent things Of counsels and knowledge,
hmr: I kuomah thil ṭhatakhai chu ka ziek a ni naw am a nih? Hrietna le thurâwnhai thua chun;

en: To make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, That thou mayest carry back words of truth to them that send thee?
hmr: Thutak thuhai a ni chiezie chu inhriettir ding chein, Nangma tirtuhai che kuoma thutak thuhai chu i phurkîr nâwk theina dingin.

en: Rob not the poor, because he is poor; Neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
hmr: Pasie chu a pasiet leiin lâkpêk naw la, Dâikawtkhâra sawisaka umhai chu nêksâwr bawk naw rawh.

en: For Jehovah will plead their cause, And despoil of life those that despoil them.
hmr: An chungthu chu LALPA chun a ṭan ding a ni sih a, Anni suksetuhai hringna chu sukse vêng a tih.

en: Make no friendship with a man that is given to anger; And with a wrathful man thou shalt not go:
hmr: Mi lunginsen hmang chu ruolah siem naw la, Mi nunsie le chun in inkawp ding a ni nawh.

en: Lest thou learn his ways, And get a snare to thy soul.
hmr: A lampuihai chu hung inchûk i ta, I lungril ta dingin châng hmu rawi i tih.

en: Be thou not one of them that strike hands, Or of them that are sureties for debts.
hmr: Kut bentuhai laia mi pakhat ang khawm chu ni naw la, Batnahai dinga intiemkamtu pakhat khawm chu ni bawk naw rawh.

en: If thou hast not wherewith to pay, Why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
hmr: Nangin pêk ding iengkhawm i nei si naw chun, Nanga hnuoia i khum chu ieng dingin am la hmang a ta?

en: Remove not the ancient landmark, Which thy fathers have set.
hmr: Inhmaa ramri chu sawn hmang naw la, I thlatuhaiin an lo khang ta chu.

en: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; He shall not stand before mean men.
hmr: Mi a sinthawa taimatak i hmu am? ama chu lalhai hmaah ngîr a tih. Mi hmusitumhai hmaa chun ngîr naw nih.

en: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, Consider diligently him that is before thee;
hmr: Rorêltu le bu fa dinga i ṭhung lai chun, I hmaa mi chu nguntakin ngaituo rawh.

en: And put a knife to thy throat, If thou be a man given to appetite.
hmr: Phîngṭâm hre mi tak i ni chun, I rîngah chemtê i sie ding a ni sih a.

en: Be not desirous of his dainties; Seeing they are deceitful food.
hmr: Inhlêmna bu an nih ti hmuin, A tuihnâinahai chu châk ve naw rawh.

en: Weary not thyself to be rich; Cease from thine own wisdom.
hmr: Hung hausa dingin insuklungkham naw la, I varnaa inthawk ngei chun bân rawh.

en: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? For riches certainly make themselves wings, Like an eagle that flieth toward heaven.
hmr: A um naw chunga chun i mithai chu infûktir naw la, Hausaknahai chun thlahai an in- siempêk ngei ngei hlak sih a; Muvânlai vântienga vuong hlak ang el chun.

en: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, Neither desire thou his dainties:
hmr: Mit rilo neitu bei chu fa naw la, A thiltuihnaihai khawm chu châk ve naw rawh.

en: For as he thinketh within himself, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; But his heart is not with thee.
hmr: Ama chu ân ngaituona ang peia um mi a ni si a, I kuoma chun, “Dâwn la, fa rawh,” a ti dea chu, A lungril ruok chu i kuomah a um nawh.

en: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, And lose thy sweet words.
hmr: Bubâr i fâk ta chu, inluoksuok nâwk i ta, I thu thlumhai chu inhmang i tih.

en: Speak not in the hearing of a fool; For he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
hmr: Mi invêt hrieta chun thu hril naw la, I thu varnahai chu a hmusit ding a ni sih a.

en: Remove not the ancient landmark; And enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
hmr: Inhmaa ramri chu sawn hmang naw la, Pa neilohai lohaia chun lût bawk naw rawh.

en: For their Redeemer is strong; He will plead their cause against thee.
hmr: Anni intlantu chu a hrât sih a, An chungthu chu nanga chungah phût rawi a tih.

en: Apply thy heart unto instruction, And thine ears to the words of knowledge.
hmr: Inchûktirna tienga chun i lungril chu hmang la, I nahai chu hrietna thuhai tienga chun.

en: Withhold not correction from the child; For if thou beat him with the rod, he will not die.
hmr: Sukdikna chu naupanga inthawk chun lakîr naw la, Hmawla i vuok chun, ama chu a thi âwm si nawh a.

en: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, And shalt deliver his soul from Sheol.
hmr: Ama chu hmawl chun vuong i ta, Seola inthawkin a thlarau chu i sansuok ding annâwm.

en: My son, if thy heart be wise, My heart will be glad, even mine:
hmr: Ka naupa, i lungril a var phawt chun, Ka lungril, keia ta ngei chu, lâwm a tih.

en: Yea, my heart will rejoice, When thy lips speak right things.
hmr: Anih, ka lungril chu hlim a ta, I hmûrhaiin thil indik a hril pha chun.

en: Let not thy heart envy sinners; But be thou in the fear of Jehovah all the day long:
hmr: I lungril chun misuolhai inhnar naw raw se, Sûnnithlâkin LALPA ṭînaa chun um zing lem rawh.

en: For surely there is a reward; And thy hope shall not be cut off.
hmr: Matheiloin chutaka chun lâwmman a um a, I beiseina chu thlâwn dêr naw nih.

en: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, And guide thy heart in the way.
hmr: Ngai la, ka naupa, hung var rawh, I lungril chu lampuia chun ṭhuoi rawh.

en: Be not among winebibbers, Among gluttonous eaters of flesh:
hmr: Hnukinrâwltaka sa fa mihai lai le Zu he mihai laia chun um naw rawh.

en: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty; And drowsiness will clothe a man with rags.
hmr: Zu inrui mi le hnukinrâwl chu hung pasieng an ta, Inruina chun mi chu puonṭiekin ân thuom ding a ni sih a.

en: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, And despise not thy mother when she is old.
hmr: I pa nang a neitu che thu hi ngai la, Chun, i nu chu a tar hnung khawma hmusit bawk naw rawh.

en: Buy the truth, and sell it not; Yea, wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
hmr: Thutak chu inchaw la, zawr ta naw rawh, Anih, varna dâm, inchûktirna dâm le hrietthiemna dâm khawm chu.

en: The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice; And he that begetteth a wise child will have joy of him.
hmr: Mi fel pa chu nasatakin hlim a ta, Chun, nau var neitu chu amaa chun hlim bawk a tih.

en: Let thy father and thy mother be glad, And let her that bare thee rejoice.
hmr: I pa le i nu chu lâwmin inumtir la, Nang a neitunu che khawm chu inlâwmtir rawh.

en: My son, give me thy heart; And let thine eyes delight in my ways.
hmr: Ka naupa, i lungril mi pe ta, Chun, ka lampuihaia chun i mithai khawm chu fu bawk raw se.

en: For a harlot is a deep ditch; And a foreign woman is a narrow pit.
hmr: Nuhmei hur chu khurse inthûk a na, Hmêlmak nuhmei chu khur inchêp a nih.

en: Yea, she lieth in wait as a robber, And increaseth the treacherous among men.
hmr: Anih, inru angin ân chân a, Mihai laia chun bawsietna chu a sukpung tah a.

en: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? Who hath complaining? who hath wounds without cause? Who hath redness of eyes?
hmr: Tuin am chungrikna chu a nei a? Tuin am lungngaina chu a nei a? Tuin am inhalna chu a nei a? Sawisêlna chu tuin am a nei a? A thawtu boin tuin am pânnahai a nei a? Mithai senna chu tuin am a nei a?

en: They that tarry long at the wine; They that go to seek out mixed wine.
hmr: Uoin hmuna sâwttak um hlakhai chun, Uoin chawkpawl zawnga fe hlakhai chun.

en: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, When it sparkleth in the cup, When it goeth down smoothly:
hmr: Uoin chu a sen lai chun nang chun en ngai naw la, Noa chun a zie chu a hung insuoh a, A hang insiemdik lai vêl chu en naw rawh.

en: At the last it biteth like a serpent, And stingeth like an adder.
hmr: A tâwpa chun rûl ang elin a chuk a, Rûlriel angin a chuk hlak.

en: Thine eyes shall behold strange things, And thy heart shall utter perverse things.
hmr: I mithai chun thilmakhai chu hmûng a ta, I lungril chun thil chapohai chu hril suok a tih.

en: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, Or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
hmr: Anih, tuisuoriet laia zâltu ang chu nîng i ta, Annawleh, lawngngul lêra zâl ang nîng i tih.

en: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not hurt; They have beaten me, and I felt it not: When shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
hmr: “Annin an mi vuok a, suknatin ka um nawh a, Annin an mi zêp a, ka hriet nawh a, Iengtik âm ka har ding a na? la zawng nâwk rawp ka tih,” i ti ding am a nih?

en: Be not thou envious against evil men; Neither desire to be with them:
hmr: Mi rilohai chu inhnar naw la, Anni le um khawm chu châk naw rawh.

en: For their heart studieth oppression, And their lips talk of mischief.
hmr: An lungril chun nêksâwr dân ân chûk a, An hmûrhai chun thilpawi hril ân chûk sih a.

en: Through wisdom is a house builded; And by understanding it is established;
hmr: Varna hmanga in chu bâwl a na, Chun, hrietthiemna hmanga tungding a ni hlak.

en: And by knowledge are the chambers filled With all precious and pleasant riches.
hmr: Chun, hrietna hmangin a pindanhai chu, Hausakna ṭhahai le hlutakhai chun suksip an nih.

en: A wise man is strong; Yea, a man of knowledge increaseth might.
hmr: Mi var chu a hrât a nih; Anih, hrietna nei mi chun hrâtna a sukpung hlak.

en: For by wise guidance thou shalt make thy war; And in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
hmr: Ṭhuoina var hmangin indona chu i siem ding a ni sih a, Chun, thurâwn petuhai tamnaa chun himna a um a nih.

en: Wisdom is too high for a fool: He openeth not his mouth in the gate.
hmr: Invêt ta ding chun varna chu ân sâng taluoh a, Dâikawtkhâra chun a bau chu a ka naw a nih.

en: He that deviseth to do evil, Men shall call him a mischief-maker.
hmr: Thil ṭha naw rawtdawktu chu Mihaiin mi pawitâwk hmangah inbûk an ta.

en: The thought of foolishness is sin; And the scoffer is an abomination to men.
hmr: Invêt ngaituona chu suol a na, Hmusittu chu mihriemhai ta dingin tirdakum a nih.

en: If thou faint in the day of adversity, Thy strength is small.
hmr: Vângduoi nia i chau el chun, I hrâtna chu a tlâwm a nih.

en: Deliver them that are carried away unto death, And those that are ready to be slain see that thou hold back.
hmr: Thinaa ṭhuoi hmanga umhai chu san suok la, That dinga inzosa ṭêpa umhai chu chelkîr rawh.

en: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew not this; Doth not he that weigheth the hearts consider it? And he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? And shall not he render to every man according to his work?
hmr: “Ngai ta u, hi mi hi kan hriet nawh,” in ti chun, Lungrilhai ngaituo bûktu chun a ngaituo naw ding am a nih? I lungril vawng ṭhatu chun a hriet naw ding am a nih? Mi tin kuomah a sinthaw ang peiin a pêk ding a ni naw am a nih?

en: My son, eat thou honey, for it is good; And the droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to thy taste:
hmr: Ka naupa, nang chun khuoizu fa rawh, a ṭha sih a; Khuoithlâr fa rawh, chu chu i bauah a thlum a nih.

en: So shalt thou know wisdom to be unto thy soul; If thou hast found it, then shall there be a reward, And thy hope shall not be cut off.
hmr: Chuongchun, i lungrila um ding varna chu hrieng i ta, I hmu suok chun, chu chun lâwmman chu um a ta, I beiseina chu sukbo ni naw nih.

en: Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the habitation of the righteous; Destroy not his resting-place:
hmr: Aw mi rilopa, mi fel chêngna chu inchân naw rawh, A châwlna hmun khawm chu sukse naw rawh.

en: For a righteous man falleth seven times, and riseth up again; But the wicked are overthrown by calamity.
hmr: Mi fel chu vawi sari tlu sien khawm a tho nâwk hlak sih a, Mi khawhlohai ruok chu lung- zîngnaa pei thlûkin an um.

en: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, And let not thy heart be glad when he is overthrown;
hmr: I hmêlma a tlûk lai chun hlim naw la, Ama chu pei thlûk a ni laiin i lungril chu lâwm naw raw se.

en: Lest Jehovah see it, and it displease him, And he turn away his wrath from him.
hmr: LALPA chun hung hmûng a ta, ama suklungawinaw rawi a ta, A lunginsenna chu amaa inthawk chun her hmang rawi a tih.

en: Fret not thyself because of evil-doers; Neither be thou envious at the wicked:
hmr: Thil suol thawtuhai leiin inlau naw la, Mi khawhlo khawm chu inhnar bawk naw rawh.

en: For there shall be no reward to the evil man; The lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
hmr: Mi rilo kuoma chun lâwmman um naw nih a, Mi khawhlo khâwnvar chu her hlum a ni ding a ni sih a.

en: My son, fear thou Jehovah and the king; And company not with them that are given to change:
hmr: Ka naupa, nang chun LALPA le lal chu ṭi la, Insukdanglam hmanghai chu vân kawppui bawk naw rawh.

en: For their calamity shall rise suddenly; And the destruction from them both, who knoweth it?
hmr: An lunginzîngna chu kârloin a ṭuong ding a ni sih a; Anni ve ve bohmangna chu tuin am hrieng a ta?

en: These also are sayings of the wise. To have respect of persons in judgment is not good.
hmr: Hienghai hi mi var thuhrilhai chu an nih, Rorêlnaa mihriemhai thlierbîk- na nei hi a ṭha nawh.

en: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous, Peoples shall curse him, nations shall abhor him;
hmr: Mi khawhlo kuomah, “Nang chu mi fel i nih”, titu chu, Mipuihaiin ama chu ṭawngsie inphur an ta, hnamhai chun ama chu tirdak an tih.

en: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, And a good blessing shall come upon them.
hmr: Ama kâwktuhai kuoma ruok chun lâwmna um a ta, Malsâwmna ṭhatak an chungah tlung a tih.

en: He kisseth the lips Who giveth a right answer.
hmr: Dawnna indik petu chu, A hmûrhaiin a fâwp a.

en: Prepare thy work without, And make it ready for thee in the field; And afterwards build thy house.
hmr: I sin chu tuolah buotsai la, Chu chu i ta dingin loah siemrêl rawh; Chu hnunga chun i in chu bâwl rawh.

en: Be not a witness against thy neighbor without cause; And deceive not with thy lips.
hmr: A san boin i vênghai chungah thuhretu ni naw la, I hmûrhai chun hlêm bawk naw rawh.

en: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.
hmr: “Ka chunga a thaw angin a chunga khawm thaw vêng ka tih, Mi chu a sinthaw ang peiin ka pêk ding nih,” ti naw rawh.

en: I went by the field of the sluggard, And by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
hmr: Mi thabo lo kâwla chun ka fe tah a, Mi hrietthiemna bo grêp huon kâwla leh.

en: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, The face thereof was covered with nettles, And the stone wall thereof was broken down.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, hlinghaiin a lo ṭhangnel vawng a, A phêkin hling bukhaiin ân khum a, A lung banghai khawm chu a chim thla bawk a.

en: Then I beheld, and considered well; I saw, and received instruction:
hmr: Chun, ka en a, ka ngaituo rak a, Inchûktirna ka hmuin ka hriet tah a.

en: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep;
hmr: La zâl deu hlek, la ininnghil deu hlek, Zâl dinga kuthai la hang inthlep deu hlek,

en: So shall thy poverty come as a robber, And thy want as an armed man.
hmr: Chuong ang chun, i pasietna chu inru angin hung a ta, I tlâksamna chu mi inrâlthuom angin hung a tih.

en: These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
hmr: Hienghai hi Solomon thuvar- hai Juda ram lal Hezekia mi- haiin an zieksâwng chu a nih.

en: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing; But the glory of kings is to search out a matter.
hmr: Thil thup hri hi Pathien ta ding chun ropuina a na, Lalhai ropuina ruok chu thil- pawi zawng suok chu a nih.

en: As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth, So the heart of kings is unsearchable.
hmr: Ân sâng tiengah vân, ân thûk tiengah leihnuoi, Lalhai lungril chu suisuok ruol a ni nawh.

en: Take away the dross from the silver, And there cometh forth a vessel for the refiner:
hmr: Tangkaruoa inthawk chun a êk chu la suok la, A sungtu ta dingin hmangruo hung ning a tih.

en: Take away the wicked from before the king, And his throne shall be established in righteousness.
hmr: Lal hmaa inthawk chun mi khawhlo chu la hmang la, A lalṭhungpha chu felnaa tungding nîng a tih.

en: Put not thyself forward in the presence of the king, And stand not in the place of great men:
hmr: Lal hmaihmaa chun nang le nang inhrilmawi naw la, Mi ropuihai hmuna khawm chun ngîr naw rawh.

en: For better is it that it be said unto thee, Come up hither, Than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince, Whom thine eyes have seen.
hmr: I mithaiin a ihmu ta hlak Lalnau hmaihmaa sukhnuoia i um nêk chun, “Hi tieng hin hung kai rawh,” i kuoma tiha um chu a ṭha lem sih a.

en: Go not forth hastily to strive, Lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, When thy neighbor hath put thee to shame.
hmr: Inkhing dingin inhmawtakin suok naw rawh, A tâwpa thaw dân ding hre si loin, I tuolbâwm chun sukzak hlau rawi a ti che.

en: Debate thy cause with thy neighbor himself, And disclose not the secret of another;
hmr: I tuolbâwm le ngei chun i chungthu chu hriltlâng unla, Mi danghai thurûk chu phuong naw rawh.

en: Lest he that heareth it revile thee, And thine infamy turn not away.
hmr: Chu chu lo hretu chun sukzak rawi a ti cheh a, I hming sietna chu bo naw hlau rawi a tih.

en: A word fitly spoken Is like apples of gold in network of silver.
hmr: A huntaka thu hril chu Tangkaraw leikhawrhaia rângkachak apple theirahai ang chu a nih.

en: As an ear-ring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, So is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
hmr: Rângkachak inthieng ṭhi le, rângkachak nabê ang el hi, Na thuawi chunga hriltu var chu a nih.

en: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, So is a faithful messenger to them that send him; For he refresheth the soul of his masters.
hmr: Ama tirtu ta dinga thangko ringum chu Busîk huna vûr deitak ang el hi a nih; A hotuhai lungril chu a sukhar hlak sih a.

en: As clouds and wind without rain, So is he that boasteth himself of his gifts falsely.
hmr: Thilpêk a ipêk naw pea inhrila uongpuitu chu, Ruo sûr loa thli le sûmhai ang chu a nih.

en: By long forbearing is a ruler persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
hmr: Tuor sâwt peina chun rorêltu chu thlêmthlûk a na, Chun, lei innêm chun ru chu a sukthliek.

en: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, Lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
hmr: Khuoizu i hmu am? I ta dinga huntâwk chu fa el rawh, Chuong naw chun, khawp taluong i ta, inluok rawi i tih.

en: Let thy foot be seldom in thy neighbor’s house, Lest he be weary of thee, and hate thee.
hmr: I tuolbâwm ina chun i ke chu lût inkhât vieu raw se, Chuong naw chun, nghawk a ti che a, theida rawi a ti che.

en: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbor Is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
hmr: Mi a tuolbâwm chunga hrietpuina indiklo phurtu chu, Hembâwk le kâwlhnâm le thal ngei a nih.

en: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble Is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
hmr: Buoina hun laia mi ringum naw chunga ringna innghat hi, Ha tlam le, ke ru suktuona inpel ang a nih.

en: As one that taketh off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon soda, So is he that singeth songs to a heavy heart.
hmr: Khaw dei laia silfên hlîptu ang le, soda chunga zuthûr buok ang el hi a nih, Lungril rimsi kuoma hla saktu chu.

en: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; And if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
hmr: I hmêlma a phîng a ṭâm chun bei fâk ding pe la, Chun, a dang a châr chun, tui dâwn ding pe rawh;

en: For thou wilt heap coals of fire upon his head, And Jehovah will reward thee.
hmr: A lu chunga chun meiling siekhâwl i ni ding a ni sih a, Chun, LALPA chun lâwmman pêng a ti che.

en: The north wind bringeth forth rain; So doth a backbiting tongue an angry countenance.
hmr: Hmâr thli chun ruo a hung ṭhuoi a, Chuong ang bawk chun mi demzuitu lei chun hmêl lunginsen a hung ṭhuoi.

en: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, Than with a contentious woman in a wide house.
hmr: Nuhmei hrângsie le in liena um nêk chun, Inchung sîp kilkhâwra chêng chu a ṭha lem.

en: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, So is good news from a far country.
hmr: Ram hlataka chanchin ṭha chu, Mi dangchâr kuoma tui deitak ang hi a nih.

en: As a troubled fountain, and a corrupted spring, So is a righteous man that giveth way before the wicked.
hmr: Mi fel mi khawhlo hmaa intuklût chu, Tuikhur tui suksiet le, tuihnâr suksiet ang hi a nih.

en: It is not good to eat much honey; So for men to search out their own glory is grievous.
hmr: Khuoizu hi fâk ṭeu el chu a ṭha nawh a; Miin mâni ropuina ding ngawt a zawng hi ropuina a ni nawh.

en: He whose spirit is without restraint Is like a city that is broken down and without walls.
hmr: Mi a lungril vêng ṭhatna neilo chu, Khawpui chim tahnung, kul bang khawm nei lo ang chu a nih.

en: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, So honor is not seemly for a fool.
hmr: Nipui laia vûr le, busîk huna ruo ân hmê naw angin, Inzâkaina hi invêt ta ding chun a âwm nawh.

en: As the sparrow in her wandering, as the swallow in her flying, So the curse that is causeless alighteth not.
hmr: Chawngzawng ân vâk ân vâk ang le, peleu a vuong lai angin, A san boa ṭawngse inphurna chu a fu ngai nawh.

en: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, And a rod for the back of fools.
hmr: Vuokna hruihruol chu sakawr ta ding a na, thîrse chu sabengtung ta ding, Chun, hmawl chu mi invêthai ruongzâng ta ding a nih.

en: Answer not a fool according to his folly, Lest thou also be like unto him.
hmr: Mi invêt chu ân vêtzie ang peiin dawn naw rawh, Chuong naw chun, ama ang hung ni rawi i tih.

en: Answer a fool according to his folly, Lest he be wise in his own conceit.
hmr: Mi invêt chu ân vêtzie ang peiin dawn rawh, Chuong naw chun, ama le ama mi varah insie hlau rawi a tih.

en: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool Cutteth off his own feet, and drinketh in damage.
hmr: Mi invêt kuta thucha thawntu chun, Ama kehai ngei chu a sât bawngin, sietna chu a dâwn a nih.

en: The legs of the lame hang loose; So is a parable in the mouth of fools.
hmr: Mi silbai kehai chu sawr thei loin ân khai zawi a, Chuong ang bawkin, invêthai baua chun tekhithu chu a nih.

en: As one that bindeth a stone in a sling, So is he that giveth honor to a fool.
hmr: Mi invêt kuoma inzâkaina petu chu, Lung inthuo kâra lunghlu ip ang a nih.

en: As a thorn that goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, So is a parable in the mouth of fools.
hmr: Mi invêthai baua tekhithu chu, Zu inrui kuta hling lût ang el hi a nih.

en: As an archer that woundeth all, So is he that hireth a fool and he that hireth them that pass by.
hmr: Mi inlawn mei meihai ruoitu le, mi invêt ruoitu chu, Thal kâptu mi po po sukhliemtu ang chu a nih.

en: As a dog that returneth to his vomit, So is a fool that repeateth his folly.
hmr: Mi invêt ân vêtna thu hril hriltu chu, Ui ama luok bawka kîr nâwk ang chu a nih.

en: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? There is more hope of a fool than of him.
hmr: Mi ama ngaidân chaua var chu i hmu hlak am? Ama nêk chun mi invêta chun beiseina lien lem a um.

en: The sluggard saith, There is a lion in the way; A lion is in the streets.
hmr: Mi thabo chun, “Sakeibaknei chu lampuiah a um a, Sakeibaknei chu kawtthlêrahai a um,” a ti hlak.

en: As the door turneth upon its hinges, So doth the sluggard upon his bed.
hmr: Kawtkhâr chu ân khainaa ân her ân her hlak angin, Mi thabo chun chuong ang bawk chun a khum chungah a thaw.

en: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish; It wearieth him to bring it again to his mouth.
hmr: Mi thabo chun thlênga chun a kut chu a phûm a, A baua hang thun nâwk ding takngiel khawm chu a lungngai hlak.

en: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit Than seven men that can render a reason.
hmr: Mi pasari a san pe theituhai nêk chun, Mi thabo chu ama ngairuotna kawnga chun a var lem.

en: He that passeth by, and vexeth himself with strife belonging not to him, Is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
hmr: Mi hung inlawn a, ama ṭhang- na ni hlek si lo inhalnaa vân suklungsen chu, Ui lâwnlai a nakâwrhaia mantu ang chu a nih.

en: As a madman who casteth firebrands, Arrows, and death,
hmr: Mi invêt thingthuhringhai, Thalhai le thina petu ang chu,

en: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbor, And saith, Am not I in sport?
hmr: Mi a tuolbâwm hlêma, “Ka fiemthu mei mei an nawm ie!” titu chu a nih.

en: For lack of wood the fire goeth out; And where there is no whisperer, contention ceaseth.
hmr: Thingthu tlâksam leiin mei chu a rêm a, Chun, milâwt hmang um nawnaa chun inkhingna a re.

en: As coals are to hot embers, and wood to fire, So is a contentious man to inflame strife.
hmr: Meihawlhai chu meiling ding le, thinghai chu mei ding an ni angin, Mi hrângsie chu inkhingna sukṭaltu a nih.

en: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, And they go down into the innermost parts.
hmr: Milâwtthiem thuhai chu bubâr tuihnâitak ang an na, Phîngsûng hmun inriltakhaia chun an fe thla.

en: Fervent lips and a wicked heart Are like an earthen vessel overlaid with silver dross.
hmr: Hmûr zumlezuor intuo le lungril suol chu, Pil bêl rângkachak êka inluon ang a nih.

en: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips; But he layeth up deceit within him:
hmr: Theidatu chun a hmûrhai chun ân tlip a, Amiruokchu, ama sûnga chun hmusitna a siekhâwl.

en: When he speaketh fair, believe him not; For there are seven abominations in his heart:
hmr: Thu a hril ṭha hle khawm a, ama chu ring naw la, A lungrila chun tirdakumna pasari a um sih a.

en: Though his hatred cover itself with guile, His wickedness shall be openly showed before the assembly.
hmr: A theidana chu ama le ama vervêknain inkhum sien khawm, A suolna chu mipui hmaa phuongphotaka inentir nîng a tih.

en: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein; And he that rolleth a stone, it shall return upon him.
hmr: Tukhawm hnuoikhur cho taphawt chu chutaka chun tlâng an ta, Tukhawm lung inhlum taphawt chu, ama chungah hung kîr a tih.

en: A lying tongue hateth those whom it hath wounded; And a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
hmr: Lei khêlinhlip chun a înhliem tahai chu a theidah a, Inpâk derna bau chun sietna sin a thaw.

en: Boast not thyself of to-morrow; For thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
hmr: Zînga dingin nang le nang insuong naw la, Ni chun ieng am a hung suokpui ding ti i hriet si nawh a.

en: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; A stranger, and not thine own lips.
hmr: Mi dangin inpâk lem raw se cheu, nangma hmûr ngeia inpâk ni loin, Hmêlmak miin ni raw se, nang- ma hmûrhai ngeiin ni loin.

en: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; But a fool’s vexation is heavier than they both.
hmr: Lung chu a rik a, phaiphin chu a khîn a; Amiruokchu, mi invêt lungin- senna chu a ieng lem lem nêk khawm chun a rik lem.

en: Wrath is cruel, and anger is overwhelming; But who is able to stand before jealousy?
hmr: Lunginsenna hi a suol a, lung- awi nawna hi a phulliem a; Amiruokchu, tu am îtthîkna hmaa chun ngîr thei a ta?

en: Better is open rebuke Than love that is hidden.
hmr: Phuongphotaka inkâwkna hi a ṭha lem, Hmangaina inthup nêk chun.

en: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; But the kisses of an enemy are profuse.
hmr: Ruol isukhliemnahai chu ring a um a, Hmêlma fâwpnahai ruok chu ringhla a um.

en: The full soul loatheth a honeycomb; But to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
hmr: Mi khawp chun khuoithlâr khawm chu a tirdak a, Mi phîngṭâm ta ding ruok chun thil kha tinrêng khawm chu a thlum.

en: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, So is a man that wandereth from his place.
hmr: Mi a hmuna inthawka invâk suok chu, Vate a bua inthawka invâk suok ang chu a nih.

en: Oil and perfume rejoice the heart; So doth the sweetness of a man’s friend that cometh of hearty counsel.
hmr: Hriek le riminhnik hin lungril a suklâwm ang bawkin, Lungril taka inthawka suok ruolpa thurâwn ṭha chun a suklâwm hlak,

en: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; And go not to thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: Better is a neighbor that is near than a brother far off.
hmr: Nangma ruol ngei ngei le, i pa ruolpa chu nghatsan naw, I lunginzîng nia chun i unaupa ina chun fe bawk naw rawh. Unau inhlatpui tak nêkin, tuolbâwm inhnaipui tak chu a ṭha lem.

en: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, That I may answer him that reproacheth me.
hmr: Ka naupa, var la, ka lungril suklâwm ta, Keima mi kâwktu chu ka dawn theina dingin.

en: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; But the simple pass on, and suffer for it.
hmr: Mi var chun thil ṭha naw chu a hmuh a, ân bihmang hlak a, Mi mâwl ruok chu a fe pei a, a tuor pha hlak.

en: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; And hold him in pledge that is surety for a foreign woman.
hmr: Hmêlmak mi ta dingin a aiawtu silfên la la, Nuhmei hmêlmak mi ta dinga mawphurtua insiem chu aiawah chel rawh.

en: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, It shall be counted a curse to him.
hmr: Zîngkâra tho a, a ruolpa ta dinga râwl inringtaka malsâwmtu chu, Ama ta ding chun ṭawngsiea ngai nîng a tih.

en: A continual dropping in a very rainy day And a contentious woman are alike:
hmr: Ruo chîng nia ruomal tla zing le, Nuhmei hrângsie chu angkhat an nih.

en: He that would restrain her restraineth the wind; And his right hand encountereth oil.
hmr: Tukhawm amanu thuptu chu thli thup a na, A kut changtiengin hriek ân suolpui a nih.

en: Iron sharpeneth iron; So a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
hmr: Thîr chu thîr bawkin a sukngei a; Chuong ang bawk chun mi chun a ruolpa hmêl chu a sukngei.

en: Whoso keepeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof; And he that regardeth his master shall be honored.
hmr: Tukhawm theichang kûng enkawl chun, chutaka a ra chu fâng a ta, A hotu lo nghâk zingtu chu chawimawi ni bawk a tih.

en: As in water face answereth to face, So the heart of man to man.
hmr: Tui sûnga hmaiin hmai a hawi angin, Mihriem lungril chu mihriem bawkah ân lang a.

en: Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied; And the eyes of man are never satisfied.
hmr: Seol le Abaddon chu an khawp ngai nawh a, Mihriem mithai khawm chu an lungawi ngai nawh.

en: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; And a man is tried by his praise.
hmr: Rawtuina bêl chu tangkaruo ta ding a na, pûm mei chu rângkachak ta ding, Chun, mihriem chu a înpâk nuom zâwngah fie a nih.

en: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with bruised grain, Yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
hmr: Bu lai fahrelin sumah invêt chu suk rak la khawm, Ân vêtna chu amaa inthawk chun inkieng chuong naw nih.

en: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, And look well to thy herds:
hmr: I ranruolhai umdân hre dingin taima hle la, I bâwngruolhai chu en ṭha rawh.

en: For riches are not for ever; And doth the crown endure unto all generations?
hmr: Hausaknahai hi kumkhuoa ding a ni nawh a, Lallukhum khawm hin suon po po chu a dai hlak am a nih?

en: The hay is carried, and the tender grass showeth itself, And the herbs of the mountains are gathered in.
hmr: Bupâwl chu lâk a na, hlohna thar innêmhai chu an hung inlang a, Chun, tlânghaia thlaihnahai khawm chu lâk khâwm an nih.

en: The lambs are for thy clothing, And the goats are the price of the field;
hmr: Berâmhai chu i silfên ding an na, Kêlhai chu lo man ding an nih.

en: And there will be goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, And maintenance for thy maidens.
hmr: Buha i ring khawp kêl nênetui um a ta, i in sûnga buha ring dingin, I nunghâkhai châwmna ding leh.

en: The wicked flee when no man pursueth; But the righteous are bold as a lion.
hmr: Mi suol chu tukhawm ihnawt naw khawmin a tlânsie a, Mi felhai ruok chu sakeibaknei angin an huoi.

en: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof; But by men of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.
hmr: Ramin a bawsiet pha chu rorêl- tu tamtak a hung nei hlak a, Nisienlakhawm, hrietna le hrietthiemna nei mihai lei chun ram chu ngirsuok a tih.

en: A needy man that oppresseth the poor Is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
hmr: Mi tlasam mi pasie nêksâwrtu chu, Ruo pheisûr bu hla lo ang chu a nih.

en: They that forsake the law praise the wicked; But such as keep the law contend with them.
hmr: Dân mâksantuhai chun mi rilo chu an inpâk a, Dân vawngtuhai chu anni leh an inkhing.

en: Evil men understand not justice; But they that seek Jehovah understand all things.
hmr: Mi suol chun rorêlna chu a hrietthiem nawh a, LALPA zawngtuhai ruok chun thil po po an hrietthiem.

en: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, Than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
hmr: Mi pasie lungril ṭha put chu Hausa khawhlotaka um nêk chun a ṭha lem.

en: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son; But he that is a companion of gluttons shameth his father.
hmr: Tukhawm dân vawngtu chu naupa var a nih, Mi hnukinrâwl inruolpuitu ruok chun a pa a sukzak.

en: He that augmenteth his substance by interest and increase, Gathereth it for him that hath pity on the poor.
hmr: Sum duâmna le hlâwkna dinga a thuomhnaw sukpungtu chun, Mi pase chunga lunginsietna neitu ta dingin a khâwlkhâwm a nih.

en: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, Even his prayer is an abomination.
hmr: Dân chu ngai dinga a na sit nawtu chu, A ṭawngṭâina khawm chu tirdakum a nih.

en: Whoso causeth the upright to go astray in an evil way, He shall fall himself into his own pit; But the perfect shall inherit good.
hmr: Tukhawm mi tluong suolna lampuia infe pêttirtu taphawt chu, Ama khur ngeia chun tlâng a tih, Mi fel ruok chun thilṭha ro chu hluong a tih.

en: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; But the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.
hmr: Mi hausa chu ama ngairuotna ngeia chun a var a, Mi pasie hrietthiemna neitu ruok chun ama chu a zawng suok hlak.

en: When the righteous triumph, there is great glory; But when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.
hmr: Mi fel chu a hlawtling pha chun, chawimawina nasatak a um hlak a, Mi khawhlo chu a tho ve pha ruok chun mi an inbihmang hlak.

en: He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper; But whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall obtain mercy.
hmr: Mi a bawsietna inkhumtu chu hlawtling naw nih a, Thupha chawia, nghatsan hlaktu ruok chun zângaina hmûng a tih.

en: Happy is the man that feareth alway; But he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
hmr: LALPA ṭi zing zinga um hlak mi chu a lâwm a, A lungril sukngartu ruok chu lungngainaah tla lût a tih.

en: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear, So is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
hmr: Rorêltu suol chu mi pase chunga chun, Sakeibaknei inrûm hlak le savawm inhûk hlak ang hi a nih.

en: The prince that lacketh understanding is also a great oppressor; But he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.
hmr: Lal naupa hrietthiemna tlasam hi nêksâwrtu nasatak a na, Hlâwkna indiklo theidatu ruok chun a nihai suksei a tih.

en: A man that is laden with the blood of any person Shall flee unto the pit; let no man stay him.
hmr: Mi tukhawm mi dang hrim hrim thisena suksipa um chu Khur tieng chun tlân hmang a ta, tukhawma chel naw raw se.

en: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be delivered; But he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.
hmr: Tukhawm tluongtaka fe mi chu sanhim nîng an ta, A lampuihaia pêthmangtu ruok chu, kârloin tlu nghâl a tih.

en: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread; But he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.
hmr: Ama ram inlettu chun bu tamtak nei a ta, Mi teplo mei meihai zuitu ruok chun, pasietna a huntâwk zet nei a tih.

en: A faithful man shall abound with blessings; But he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be unpunished.
hmr: Mi ringum chun malsâwmnahai a hau a, Mi hausa dinga hmawsaruma thilthaw ruok chu hrem lo ni naw nih.

en: To have respect of persons is not good; Neither that a man should transgress for a piece of bread.
hmr: Mihai thlierbîkna nei hi a ṭha nawh a, Bei hlek lei mei meiin min a bawsiet bawk ding a ni nawh.

en: He that hath an evil eye hasteth after riches, And knoweth not that want shall come upon him.
hmr: Mit rilo neitu chun hausakna- hai a bawin a bawh a, Tlâksamna a chungah a hung tlung ding a nih ti a hriet nawh.

en: He that rebuketh a man shall afterward find more favor Than he that flattereth with the tongue.
hmr: Leia mi inpâkdertu nêk chun. Mi kâwktu chun a hnungah dit- sakna tam lem hmûng a tih.

en: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression, The same is the companion of a destroyer.
hmr: Tukhawm a nu amanih, a pa amani inrupêk a, “Bawsietna a ni nawh,” titu chu, Chu mi chu suksetu ruolpa chu a nih.

en: He that is of a greedy spirit stirreth up strife; But he that putteth his trust in Jehovah shall be made fat.
hmr: Lungrila huomhap mi chun inkhingna a chawktho a; LALPA chunga a ringna innghattu ruok chu sukthâu nîng a tih.

en: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool; But whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
hmr: Mi mâni lungril ngawt ringtu chu invêt a nih, Tukhawm vartaka fetu ruok chu, ama chu sanhim nîng a tih.

en: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack; But he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
hmr: Mi pase kuoma petu chu tlasam ngai naw nih a, A mithai insimsan el hlaktu ruok chun ṭawngsie tamtak phur a tih.

en: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves; But when they perish, the righteous increase.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu a tho ve pha khawm, mi an inbihmang hlak a, Amiruokchu, an bohmang chun, mi fel chu an pung hlak.

en: He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck Shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
hmr: Kâwka um rawpa, rîng sukngar hlak chu, Kârloin se dar a ta, sukdam nâwkna um naw nih.

en: When the righteous are increased, the people rejoice; But when a wicked man beareth rule, the people sigh.
hmr: Mi felhai chu an hung hlâwk pha chun mihaiin an lâwmpui a, Mi khawhloin, rorêlna chu a phur pha ruok chun mihai chu an kahâk.

en: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father; But he that keepeth company with harlots wasteth his substance.
hmr: Varna hmangaitu chu a pa chunga chun a hlim a, Nawchizawr le inpâwlna neitu ruok chun a thuomhnaw a sukthâm.

en: The king by justice establisheth the land; But he that exacteth gifts overthroweth it.
hmr: Lal chun rorêlna felin ram chu a tungding a, Amiruokchu, thilthlâwnpêkhai dawngtu chun a suksiet.

en: A man that flattereth his neighbor Spreadeth a net for his steps.
hmr: Mi a tuolbâwm inpâkdertu chun, A kalchawihai ta dingin lên a pha a nih.

en: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare; But the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
hmr: Mi suol bawsietnaa hin châng a um a, Mi fel ruok chun hla a sak a, a hlim hlak.

en: The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor; The wicked hath not understanding to know it.
hmr: Mi fel chun mi pasie chungthu chu a hrietpui hlak a, Mi khawhlo chun hre dingin hrietthiemna a nei nawh.

en: Scoffers set a city in a flame; But wise men turn away wrath.
hmr: Mi hmusittuhai chun khawpui chu meiin an rawh a, Mi varhai ruok chun lunginsen- na an hnawt hmang.

en: If a wise man hath a controversy with a foolish man, Whether he be angry or laugh, there will be no rest.
hmr: Mi varin mi invêt ân khingpui chun, A lunginsenin amanih, ân nuiin amani khawm, sâwldam um naw nih.

en: The bloodthirsty hate him that is perfect; And as for the upright, they seek his life.
hmr: Mi feltak chu thisen insuo inhâwk mi chun a theidah a, Mi tluong ruok chun a hringna ding a zawng.

en: A fool uttereth all his anger; But a wise man keepeth it back and stilleth it.
hmr: Mi invêt chun a lunginsenna thu po po a sâksuok hlak a, Mi var ruok chun a kawl tlat a, a sukdei hlak.

en: If a ruler hearkeneth to falsehood, All his servants are wicked.
hmr: Rorêltuin thil indik naw thu a ngai chun, A siehlawhai po po chu an rilo hlak.

en: The poor man and the oppressor meet together; Jehovah lighteneth the eyes of them both.
hmr: Mi pasie le nêksâwrtu chu an intuok a, LALPA chun anni mithai ve ve chu a sukvar a.

en: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, His throne shall be established for ever.
hmr: Lal, mi pasiehai ringumtaka ro rêlpêk hlaktu chu, A lalṭhungpha chu kumkhuoin tungding nîng a tih.

en: The rod and reproof give wisdom; But a child left to himself causeth shame to his mother.
hmr: Hmawl le kâwkna hin varna a pêk a, Amiruokchu, naupang a khâta mâksan el hin a nu chu a sukzak hlak.

en: When the wicked are increased, transgression increaseth; But the righteous shall look upon their fall.
hmr: Mi khawhlohai chu an hlâwk pha chun, bawsietna khawm a pung hlak, Mi fel ruok chun an tlûkna chu hmûng an tih.

en: Correct thy son, and he will give thee rest; Yea, he will give delight unto thy soul.
hmr: I naupa chu sukdik la, sâwldamna pêng a ti che, Anih, i lungrila chun lâwmna pêng a ti che.

en: Where there is no vision, the people cast off restraint; But he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
hmr: Hmulâwkna um nawna hmuna chun mihai an bohmang hlak a, Dân vawng ṭhatu ruok chu a hlim a nih.

en: A servant will not be corrected by words; For though he understand, he will not give heed.
hmr: Siehlaw chu thu ngawt chun siem ṭhat ni naw nih a, Hrethiem sien khawm a pawisa âwm si nawh a.

en: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? There is more hope of a fool than of him.
hmr: A thuhaia inhmaw mi i hmu hlak am? Ama nêk chun mi invêta khawm beiseina a tam lem a nih.

en: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child Shall have him become a son at the last.
hmr: Naupanga inthawka indawitaka a siehlaw sukpuitlingtu chun, A tâwpa chun naupa hung innitir a tih.

en: An angry man stirreth up strife, And a wrathful man aboundeth in transgression.
hmr: Mi lunginsen chun inkhingna a chawktho a, Mi lungsen hmang chu bawsietnain a sip a nih.

en: A man’s pride shall bring him low; But he that is of a lowly spirit shall obtain honor.
hmr: Mi chu a chapona chun ama chu sukhnuoi a ta, Lungrila inngaitlâwm ruok chun chawimawina hmûng a tih.

en: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul; He heareth the adjuration and uttereth nothing.
hmr: Rûkru inṭâwmpuina neitu chun ama lungril ngei khawm a theida hlak a, Ṭawngsie inphurna ri chu a hriet hlak a chu iengkhawm a sâksuok ngai nawh.

en: The fear of man bringeth a snare; But whoso putteth his trust in Jehovah shall be safe.
hmr: Mihriem ṭîna hin châng a hung siem a, LALPAA a ringna innghattu ruok chu him a tih.

en: Many seek the ruler’s favor; But a man’s judgment cometh from Jehovah.
hmr: Mi tamtakin rorêltu ditsakna chu an zawng hlak a, Amiruokchu, mihriem rorêlna chu LALPAA inthawka hung a nih.

en: An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous; And he that is upright in the way is an abomination to the wicked.
hmr: Mi indik naw chu mi fel ta dingin tirdakum a ni a, Mi tluong chu mi khawhlo ta dingin tirdakum a ni ve thung.

en: My son, forget not my law; But let thy heart keep my commandments:
hmr: Ka naupa, ka inchûktirna hi theinghil naw la, Ka thupêkhai hi i lungrilin vawng tlat lem raw se:

en: For length of days, and years of life, And peace, will they add to thee.
hmr: Nihai seina le dam sûng kumhai, Thlamuongna leh an belsa ding che a ni sih a.

en: Let not kindness and truth forsake thee: Bind them about thy neck; Write them upon the tablet of thy heart:
hmr: Lunginsietna le thudik chun nghatsan naw sienla che: I rîngah vêt tlat la, I lungril phêk chunga chun ziek rawh.

en: So shalt thou find favor and good understanding In the sight of God and man.
hmr: Chuongchun, mihriem le Pathien mithmuah, Hrietthiemna ṭha le ditsakna hmûng i tih.

en: Trust in Jehovah with all thy heart, And lean not upon thine own understanding:
hmr: I lungril po poin LALPA chu ring la, Nanga hrietthiemna ringawta chun innghat naw rawh.

en: In all thy ways acknowledge him, And he will direct thy paths.
hmr: I lampuihai po poa chun ama hre zing la, Amân i lampuihai chu suktluong a tih.

en: Be not wise in thine own eyes; Fear Jehovah, and depart from evil:
hmr: Nanga mithaia ringawt chun var naw la, LALPA chu ṭi la, rîtlona chu mâksan rawh.

en: It will be health to thy navel, And marrow to thy bones.
hmr: I laibua dingin hrisêlna nîng a ta, I ruhai ta dingin thlin.

en: Honor Jehovah with thy substance, And with the first-fruits of all thine increase:
hmr: I thilneia chun LALPA chu inza la, I hlâwkna po po rahmasahaia le chun,

en: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, And thy vats shall overflow with new wine.
hmr: Chuongchun,i bu inhai chu tamtaka suksip nîng a ta, I sâwrna khurhai chu uoin tharin luong liem a tih.

en: My son, despise not the chastening of Jehovah; Neither be weary of his reproof:
hmr: Ka naupa, LALPA thununna chu ngainêp naw la, A kâwkna chu ngaitha bawk naw rawh.

en: For whom Jehovah loveth he reproveth, Even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
hmr: LALPA chun a hmangai chu a kâwk hlak a; Naupa a ilâwm chunga pain a kâwk ang elin.

en: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, And the man that getteth understanding.
hmr: Varna hmu suok mi chu a hlim a, Hrietthiemna nei mi chu a hlim a nih.

en: For the gaining of it is better than the gaining of silver, And the profit thereof than fine gold.
hmr: Chu thuomhnaw chu tangka thuomhnaw nêkin a ṭha lem a, Chutaka hlâwk khawm chu rângkachak inthieng nêkin a ṭha lem sih a.

en: She is more precious than rubies: And none of the things thou canst desire are to be compared unto her.
hmr: Lunghluhai nêkin a hlu lem a; Thil i dit theihai a ieng ieng le khawm chun hrilkhi ruol a ni nawh.

en: Length of days is in her right hand; In her left hand are riches and honor.
hmr: A kut changtieng chun nihai seina chu a um a; A kut vawitieng chun hausaknahai le inzaumna an um bawk a.

en: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace.
hmr: A lampuihai chu inhawitirna lampui an na, A lampuihai po po chu thlamuongna a nih.

en: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: And happy is every one that retaineth her.
hmr: Ama cheltuhai ta ding chun hringna thing kûng a na, Ama kawl tlat theitu chu a hlim a nih.

en: Jehovah by wisdom founded the earth; By understanding he established the heavens.
hmr: LALPA chun varnain hnuoi chu a hmu suok a; Hrietthiemnain vânhai chu ân ngîr bawk a.

en: By his knowledge the depths were broken up, And the skies drop down the dew.
hmr: A hrietnain lithûkhai chu a sukdar a, Vânhai chun daidâw an insûrtir a.

en: My son, let them not depart from thine eyes; Keep sound wisdom and discretion:
hmr: Ka naupa, i mithmuhaia inthawk chun anni chu infehmangtir naw la, Ngairuotthiemna le varna hrisêl chu kawl tlat rawh.

en: So shall they be life unto thy soul, And grace to thy neck.
hmr: Chuongchun, i thlarau ta dingin hringna nîng an ta, I rîng ta dingin zângaina nîng an tih.

en: Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, And thy foot shall not stumble.
hmr: Chun, i lampuiah himtakin fe tâng i ta, I ke khawm insui ta naw nih.

en: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: Yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
hmr: I zâl pha khawm chun, ṭi ta naw ti nih a, Anih, zâl i ta, îmu inhniktakin in i tih.

en: Be not afraid of sudden fear, Neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh:
hmr: Ṭina thut chu ṭi naw la, Mi khawhlo sukṭitna a hung pha khawm ṭi bawk naw rawh.

en: For Jehovah will be thy confidence, And will keep thy foot from being taken.
hmr: LALPA chu i ringsan nîng a ta, I ke chu lâk hmangnaa inthawkin a vêng ding a ni sih a.

en: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, When it is in the power of thy hand to do it.
hmr: I kut thilthawtheinaa thaw thei a ni sûng chun, Thilṭha chu a chang âwm hrimhai kuoma chu inro naw rawh.

en: Say not unto thy neighbor, Go, and come again, And to-morrow I will give; When thou hast it by thee.
hmr: I tuolbâwm kuoma chun, “Fe la, hung nâwk rawh, Zîngah pêng ka tih,” ti naw rawh, Nangin i nei lai a ni phawt chun.

en: Devise not evil against thy neighbor, Seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
hmr: I lakah lungmuongtaka a um hmu zing si chun, I tuolbâwm chunga chun thil ṭha naw suongtuo naw.

en: Strive not with a man without cause, If he have done thee no harm.
hmr: Nang a sukpawi naw che chun, A san boin mi insukbuoipui naw rawh.

en: Envy thou not the man of violence, And choose none of his ways.
hmr: Mi nunrâwng chu inhnar naw la, A lampuihai hrim hrim chu thlang ngai naw rawh;

en: For the perverse is an abomination to Jehovah; But his friendship is with the upright.
hmr: Khêlinhlipna hi LALPA ngaia chun tirdakum a ni sih a. A thurâwn ruok chu mi tluong kuomah a um.

en: The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked; But he blesseth the habitation of the righteous.
hmr: LALPA ṭawngsie chu mi khawhlo inah a um a, Mi fel chêngna ruok chu mal a sâwm hlak.

en: Surely he scoffeth at the scoffers; But he giveth grace unto the lowly.
hmr: Hmusittuhai chu a hmusit ngei ngei a, Inngaitlâwmhai ruok chu zângaina a pêk hlak.

en: The wise shall inherit glory; But shame shall be the promotion of fools.
hmr: Mi var chun ropuina chu hluong a ta, Amiruokchu, invêthai kaisângna chu inzakna nîng a tih.

en: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh; the oracle. The man saith unto Ithiel, unto Ithiel and Ucal:
hmr: Jake naupa Agur thuhai chu: thuvar chu. Mi chun Ithiel kuomah a hril a, Ithiel le Ukal kuoma chun: “Aw Pathien, kei le kei kân nghawk a,

en: Surely I am more brutish than any man, And have not the understanding of a man;
hmr: Mi dang hrim hrim nêkin ka ngawng bîk a ni ngei âwm, Mihriem hrietthiemna khawm hi ka nei nawh.

en: And I have not learned wisdom, Neither have I the knowledge of the Holy One.
hmr: Chun, varna khawm chu kân chûk nawh a, Mi Inthieng hrietna khawm chu ka nei bawk nawh.

en: Who hath ascended up into heaven, and descended? Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound the waters in his garment? Who hath established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou knowest?
hmr: Tu am vâna chun a hang lâwnin a hung ṭum leh? Tuin am a kuttum sûngah thli chu a siekhâwl hlak a? Tuin am a silfênin tuihai chu a ting hlak a? Tuin am hnuoi kil tâwphai po po chu a tungding a? A hming ieng am a na, a naupa hming khawm ieng am a na, i hriet am?”

en: Every word of God is tried: He is a shield unto them that take refuge in him.
hmr: Pathien thu tin chu sukthiengin a um a, Ama ringtuhai ta ding chun ama chu phaw a nih.

en: Add thou not unto his words, Lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
hmr: A thuhai chu nang chun belsa naw la, Kâwk rawi a ti cheh a, khêlinhlip i nih ti hmu suok ni rawi a tih.

en: Two things have I asked of thee; Deny me them not before I die:
hmr: Thil pahni ka hni cheh a, Ka thi hma hin mi hung inphatpêk tâwl naw rawh.

en: Remove far from me falsehood and lies; Give me neither poverty nor riches; Feed me with the food that is needful for me:
hmr: Keimaa inthawka hlatakah teplo nina le khêlhlipna hi sawnhmang la, Hausakna amanih, pasietna amani khawm mi pe naw rawh; Keia ta dinga pawimaw bu chun mi châwm lem rawh.

en: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is Jehovah? Or lest I be poor, and steal, And use profanely the name of my God.
hmr: Ka hung tlai hin inphat ka ti cheh a “LALPA chu tu am a na?” ti hlau rawi ka tih, Annawleh, ka hung pasiet hin inru rawi ka ta, Ka Pathien hming hi hrilsiet- nain hmang rawi ka tih.

en: Slander not a servant unto his master, Lest he curse thee, and thou be held guilty.
hmr: Siehlaw chu a hotu kuoma chun hrilse naw la, Ṭawngsie inphur a ti cheh a, thiemnaw chang hlau rawi i tih.

en: There is a generation that curse their father, And bless not their mother.
hmr: Thla pakhat an thlatuhai hrilse hlak chu an um a, An nuhai khawm chu mal an sâwm bawk nawh.

en: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, And yet are not washed from their filthiness.
hmr: Thla pakhat anni mithmua inthieng chu an um a, Anni chu an tirdakumnaa inthawka lân sâwpfai lo an nih.

en: There is a generation, oh how lofty are their eyes! And their eyelids are lifted up.
hmr: Thla pakhat an um a, aw an mithai chu a vân sâng ngei de! An mit vunhai chu a tungin ân hlîm a.

en: There is a generation whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, To devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
hmr: Thla pakhat an hahai kâwlhnâm ang le, an ha hnuoihai chemtêhai ang el chu an um a, Mihriem laia mi tlasamhai le hnuoia inthawka mi pasiehai chu fa zo ding elin.

en: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, Yea, four that say not, Enough:
hmr: Lît chun naunuhmei pahni “Mi pe, mi pe” tiha khêk khêkhai chu a nei a, Thil pathum khawptâwk ngai hrim hrim lo chu an um a, Anih, pali “A huntâwk” ti ngailohai chu an um a.

en: Sheol; and the barren womb; The earth that is not satisfied with water; And the fire that saith not, Enough.
hmr: Thlân le, sul ching chu: Hnuoi, tuia tlai zo ngai lo, Chun, mei “A huntâwk,” ti ngai der lo chu.

en: The eye that mocketh at his father, And despiseth to obey his mother, The ravens of the valley shall pick it out, And the young eagles shall eat it.
hmr: Mit a pa chu nuisan a, A nu thu awi dinga hmusittu chu, Phairuom vaâkhai chun kheldawk an ta; Mulukawlhai chun fâng an tih.

en: There are three things which are too wonderful for me, Yea, four which I know not:
hmr: Keia ta dinga thil mak taluo pathum an um a, Anih, pali ka hriet lohai chu;

en: The way of an eagle in the air; The way of a serpent upon a rock; The way of a ship in the midst of the sea; And the way of a man with a maiden.
hmr: Boruoka muvânlai lampui chu; Lungpui chunga rûlpui lampui chu; Tuisuoriet laia lawng lampui chu; Chun, pasal le nunghâk lampui le chun.

en: So is the way of an adulterous woman; She eateth, and wipeth her mouth, And saith, I have done no wickedness.
hmr: Nuhmei uire lampui khawm chuong ang bawk chu a na, A fâk a, a hmûr chu a hrûk a, “Thil suol ka thaw nawh,” a ti nâwk a.

en: For three things the earth doth tremble, And for four, which it cannot bear:
hmr: Leihnuoi hi thil pathum leiin ân thin hlak a, Chun, pali, a tuor zo naw chu a um a.

en: For a servant when he is king; And a fool when he is filled with food;
hmr: Siehlaw chu lal a hung ni pha chun; Mi invêt chu fâk dinga suksipa a um pha chun;

en: For an odious woman when she is married; And a handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
hmr: Nuhmei hrângsie pasal a nei pha le chun; Chun, siehlawnu chu a pi rohluotu a hung ni le chun.

en: There are four things which are little upon the earth, But they are exceeding wise:
hmr: Hnuoi chunga hin thil pali chite tehai chu an um a, Amiruokchu, nasatakin an var a;

en: The ants are a people not strong, Yet they provide their food in the summer;
hmr: Phaivânghai hi a pâwlpui an ni veh a, hrât lotak, Nipui sûngin an bu an siekhawl.

en: The conies are but a feeble folk, Yet make they their houses in the rocks;
hmr: Zupui hi a ruol hrât lotak an na, Anachu, an inhai chu lungpuihaia chun an siem.

en: The locusts have no king, Yet go they forth all of them by bands;
hmr: Khâuṭhikṭhihai hin lal an nei nawh a, Anachu, an rêngin a pâwlin an fe suok.

en: The lizard taketh hold with her hands, Yet is she in kings’ palaces.
hmr: Chawlru hi a kuthaia incheltâng el a na chu, Ama chu lal in ropuiahai chun a um hlak.

en: There are three things which are stately in their march, Yea, four which are stately in going:
hmr: Thil pathum an fenaa pângngai zing an um a, Anih, pali, fenaa danglam lo an um a.

en: The lion, which is mightiest among beasts, And turneth not away for any;
hmr: Sakeibaknei, ramsa po po laia thilthawtheitak chu, Thil ieng ding khawmin a pêt ngai nawh a,

en: The greyhound; the he-goat also; And the king against whom there is no rising up.
hmr: Uithiem; Sakêl khawm; Chun, lal a sipaihai le um chu.

en: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, Or if thou hast thought evil, Lay thy hand upon thy mouth.
hmr: Nangma chu în chawisânga invêttaka i thaw chun, Annawleh, thil suol dâm chu i ngaituo chun; I kut chun i bau hip rawh.

en: For the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, And the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood; So the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
hmr: Bâwng nenetui sâwr chun bâwng nene thau a hung lâk suok a, Chun, hnâr hmet chun thisen a hung lâk suok a; Chuongchun, lunginsenna suktho chun inkhingna a hung lâk suok.

en: The words of king Lemuel; the oracle which his mother taught him.
hmr: Lal Lemuel thuhai chu; thuvar a nuin ama a inchûktir chu.

en: What, my son? and what, O son of my womb? And what, O son of my vows?
hmr: Ieng am, ka naupa? Ieng am, ka sul ra ka naupa? Ieng am, ka thutiemhai naupa?

en: Give not thy strength unto women, Nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
hmr: Nuhmeihai kuoma chun i hrâtna pe naw la, Lalhai sukbohmang hlaktu kuoma chun i lampuihai pe bawk naw rawh.

en: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; Nor for princes to say, Where is strong drink?
hmr: Aw Lemuel, uoin dâwn hi lalhai ta ding a ni nawh a, lalhai ta ding a ni nawh; Lal naupahai khawm chun, “Zu khâw lai am a um a”? ti ding an ni nawh.

en: Lest they drink, and forget the law, And pervert the justice due to any that is afflicted.
hmr: Inrui hlau an ta, dân chu theinghil an ta, Suknawmnata um tukhawm ta dinga rorêlna chu her kâwi hlau an tih.

en: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, And wine unto the bitter in soul:
hmr: Bohmang el dinga inzosa zing kuoma chun zu chu pe la, Lungrila rimsi kuoma chun uoin chu pe rawh.

en: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, And remember his misery no more.
hmr: Indâwntir la, a tlâksamna chu theinghil raw se, A pasietna chu hre zing bawk ta naw raw se.

en: Open thy mouth for the dumb, In the cause of all such as are left desolate.
hmr: Ṭawngtheilo ta ding chun i bau ka la, Chuong ang po po chungthua chun rausana mâksan an nih.

en: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, And minister justice to the poor and needy.
hmr: I bau chu ka la, feltakin ro chu rêl la, Chun, tlasamhai le pasiehai ta ding chun rorêlna rawng chu bâwl rawh.

en: A worthy woman who can find? For her price is far above rubies.
hmr: Nuhmei ringum chu tuin am hmu thei a ta? A hlutna chu lung mantamhai nêkin ân sâng dai sih a.

en: The heart of her husband trusteth in her, And he shall have no lack of gain.
hmr: A pasal lungril chun ama chu a ring a, Hlâwkna tlâksamna hrim hrim nei naw nih.

en: She doeth him good and not evil All the days of her life.
hmr: Amanu chun a dam sûng nihaia po po chun, Ama chu a thaw ṭhah a, a sukṭha naw ngai nawh.

en: She seeketh wool and flax, And worketh willingly with her hands.
hmr: Pat le sahmul dâm chu a zawng a, A kuthai chun thafântakin sin a thaw hlak.

en: She is like the merchant-ships; She bringeth her bread from afar.
hmr: Amanu chu sumdâwng mi lawnghai ang a na, Hlataka inthawkin a bu chu a hung lâk hlak.

en: She riseth also while it is yet night, And giveth food to her household, And their task to her maidens.
hmr: Zân a lân thim lai khawmin a tho a, A sûngkuohai ta ding chun bu a pêk hlak a, A siehlawnuhai ta dingin an chanpuol chu a pêk hlak.

en: She considereth a field, and buyeth it; With the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
hmr: Lo chu a ngaituoh a, ân châwk a. A kuthai rasuok chun an grêphrui a phun a.

en: She girdeth her loins with strength, And maketh strong her arms.
hmr: Hrâtnain a kâwng chu a hrên a, A kuthai chu a sukhrât a.

en: She perceiveth that her merchandise is profitable; Her lamp goeth not out by night.
hmr: A sumdâwngna chu a hlâwk a nih ti chu a hmuh a, A khâwnvar chu zâna khawm chun a thi ngai nawh.

en: She layeth her hands to the distaff, And her hands hold the spindle.
hmr: A kuthai chu sûthlâmah ân nghat a, A kuthai chun hmuithal chu a chel a.

en: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; Yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
hmr: Mi pasiehai tienga chun a kut chu a phar a; Anih, mi tlasamhai chu a kuthai chu ân tlungtir hlak.

en: She is not afraid of the snow for her household; For all her household are clothed with scarlet.
hmr: A insûng ta ding chun vûr chu a ṭi nawh a, A insûng sûngkuohai po po chu sen inlâra inthuom an ni sih a.

en: She maketh for herself carpets of tapestry; Her clothing is fine linen and purple.
hmr: Ama ta ding chun puon kawp ta ṭiel ṭhungphahai a siem a, A silfên chu puon zai inhmi kawp dumpâwl a nih.

en: Her husband is known in the gates, When he sitteth among the elders of the land.
hmr: Daikawtkhârhaia chun a pasal chu hriet a na, Ram upahai laia a ṭhung lai khawm chun.

en: She maketh linen garments and selleth them, And delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
hmr: Puon zai inhmi silfênhai a siem a, a zawr a, Dâwrkaihai kuoma chun kâwngkhihai a pêk a.

en: Strength and dignity are her clothing; And she laugheth at the time to come.
hmr: Hrâtna le inzaumna chu a silfên an na, Hun la hung tlunga ding khawm chun ân nui a.

en: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; And the law of kindness is on her tongue.
hmr: Varna leh a bau chu a kah a; Lunginsietna inchûktirna chu a leia chun a um a.

en: She looketh well to the ways of her household, And eateth not the bread of idleness.
hmr: A insûng ta dinga lampuihai chu ṭhatakin a en a, Thabona bei hrim hrim chu a fâk ngai nawh.

en: Her children rise up, and call her blessed; Her husband also, and he praiseth her, saying:
hmr: A nauhai chu an tho a, ama chu vângnei an ta, A pasal khawm chun, ama chu ân pâk a;

en: Many daughters have done worthily, But thou excellest them all.
hmr: “Naunuhmei tamtakhai chun ringumtakin an thaw tah a; Amiruokchu, nang chun an rêngin i khûm vawng a,” tiin.

en: Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain; But a woman that feareth Jehovah, she shall be praised.
hmr: Ditsakna hi hmusitum a na, mawina khawm hi teplo mei mei a nih, Amiruokchu, nuhmei LALPA ṭitu chu, ama chu inpâkin um a tih.

en: Give her of the fruit of her hands; And let her works praise her in the gates.
hmr: A kuthai rasuok chu ama chu pe la, Dâikawtkhârhaia chun a sinthawhai chun ama chu inpâk raw se.

en: Hear, my sons, the instruction of a father, And attend to know understanding:
hmr: Ka naupasalhai, pa inchûktirna hi lo ngai unla, Hrietthiemna hre dingin ngaisak ro.

en: For I give you good doctrine; Forsake ye not my law.
hmr: Thuinchûktir ṭha chu ka pêk si cheu a, Ka inchûktirna hi nghatsan naw ro.

en: For I was a son unto my father, Tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
hmr: Ka pa ta dingin naupasal ka na, Ka nu mithmua chun duotum le dittak ka ni ngâwk a.

en: And he taught me, and said unto me: Let thy heart retain my words; Keep my commandments, and live;
hmr: Chun, a mîn chûktir a, ka kuomah a hril a, “Ka thuhai hi i lungril invawngtir zing la; Ka thupêkhai hi vawng la, hring rawh;

en: Get wisdom, get understanding; Forget not, neither decline from the words of my mouth;
hmr: Varna hung nei la, hrietthiemna khawm hung nei rawh, Theinghil hlek naw la, ka baua suok thuhaia inthawkin in- tâwl hmang bawk naw rawh;

en: Forsake her not, and she will preserve thee; Love her, and she will keep thee.
hmr: Ama chu nghatsan naw la, vawngṭhâng a ti cheh a, Ama chu hmangai la, vêng a ti che.

en: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom; Yea, with all thy getting get understanding.
hmr: Varna chu thil bulpui tak a na, chuleiin, varna nei rawh; Anih, i nei tasahai po poa chun hrietthiemna nei rawh.

en: Exalt her, and she will promote thee; She will bring thee to honor, when thou dost embrace her.
hmr: Ama chu chawimawi la, ama chun inkaisângtir a ti che, Ama i pawm chun inzaumtakin siem a ti che.

en: She will give to thy head a chaplet of grace; A crown of beauty will she deliver to thee.
hmr: I lua dingin zângaina lukhum pêng a ti cheh a, Mawina lallukhum pêng a ti che,” tiin.

en: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; And the years of thy life shall be many.
hmr: Aw ka naupa, ngai la, ka thuhrilhai hi lo pawm la, I dam sûng kumhai chu tamtak hung nîng a tih.

en: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in paths of uprightness.
hmr: Varna lampuia chun kân chûktir ta cheh a; Felna lampuihaia chun ka ṭhuoi ta che a nih.

en: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; And if thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
hmr: I fe pha chun, i kalchawihai chu zâng a ta; Chun, i tlân khawmin, insui naw ti nih.

en: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: Keep her; for she is thy life.
hmr: Inchûktirna chu cheldet tlat la, infetir dêr naw rawh; Kawl tlat rawh, ama chu i hringna a ni sih a.

en: Enter not into the path of the wicked, And walk not in the way of evil men.
hmr: Mi khawhlo lampuia chun lût naw la, Mi rilohai lampui chu hraw naw rawh.

en: Avoid it, pass not by it; Turn from it, and pass on.
hmr: Pumpel la, achun fe dêr naw; Chutaka inthawk chun inherhmang la, fe pei rawh.

en: For they sleep not, except they do evil; And their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
hmr: Thil pawi an thaw zet naw chun an in ngai si nawh a; Mi ṭhenkhat bêk an sukthlûk naw chun, an îmu chu lâk hmang a ni hlak.

en: For they eat the bread of wickedness, And drink the wine of violence.
hmr: Khawhlona bei chu an fâkin, Nunrâwngna uoin chu an dâwn hlak sih a.

en: But the path of the righteous is as the dawning light, That shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
hmr: Mi fel lampui ruok chu zîng khawvar ang a na, Sûn chang lai chena var deu deu ang chu.

en: The way of the wicked is as darkness: They know not at what they stumble.
hmr: Mi khawhlohai lampui chu inthimna ang a na, Ieng âm an insui ti khawm an hriet nawh.

en: My son, attend to my words; Incline thine ear unto my sayings.
hmr: Ka naupa, ka thuhai hi pawisa la, Ka thuhrilhai tieng hin i na chu sit rawh.

en: Let them not depart from thine eyes; Keep them in the midst of thy heart.
hmr: I mithmua inthawk infe hmangtir naw la, I lungril sûng taka chun kawl tlat rawh.

en: For they are life unto those that find them, And health to all their flesh.
hmr: A hmutuhai ta dingin hringna an na, An taksa ta dingin hrisêlna an ni sih a.

en: Keep thy heart with all diligence; For out of it are the issues of life.
hmr: Fîmkhur thei tâwpin i lungril chu vêng ṭha rawh, Chutaka inthawk chun hringna rasuokhai chu a um sih a.

en: Put away from thee a wayward mouth, And perverse lips put far from thee.
hmr: Ṭawng ki nei hrim chîng naw la, Khêl hril chu bân dai rawh.

en: Let thine eyes look right on, And let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
hmr: I mithai chun hmatieng chau en sienla, I khaw nghat chun i hmatieng thlîr tlat raw se.

en: Make level the path of thy feet, And let all thy ways be established.
hmr: Ngaiven dêkin i kal chawi la, I lampui chu sukdet ni raw se.

en: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: Remove thy foot from evil.
hmr: Changtieng khawm, vawitieng khawm pêt naw la, Suola inthawk i ke her hmang rawh.

en: My son, attend unto my wisdom; Incline thine ear to my understanding:
hmr: Ka naupa, ka varna hi pawisa la, Ka hrietthiemna tieng hin i na sit rawh,

en: That thou mayest preserve discretion, And that thy lips may keep knowledge.
hmr: Ngairuotthiemna chu i vawng tlat theia, I hmûrhai chun hrietna a kawl tlat theina dingin.

en: For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, And her mouth is smoother than oil:
hmr: Hmêlmak nuhmei hmûrhai chu khuoizuin a far a, A bau chu hriek nêkin ân nâl lem sih a.

en: But in the end she is bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a two-edged sword.
hmr: A tâwptieng ruok chu sairam khâkin a kha a, Kâwlhnâm ngeituo angin a ngei a.

en: Her feet go down to death; Her steps take hold on Sheol;
hmr: A kehai chu thinaah a fe thla a, A kalchawihai chun Seol a sir hlak.

en: So that she findeth not the level path of life: Her ways are unstable, and she knoweth it not.
hmr: Chuongchun, hringna lampui inphei chu a hmu ngai nawh a, A lampuihai chu mumal neilo a na, ama chun a hriet nawh.

en: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me, And depart not from the words of my mouth.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin ka naupasalhai, mi lo ngai unla, Ka baua thuhaia inthawk hin fe hmang naw ro.

en: Remove thy way far from her, And come not nigh the door of her house;
hmr: Amanua inthawk chun in lam- pui chu hlataka sawn unla, A in kawtkhâr hnaia khawm fe naw ro.

en: Lest thou give thine honor unto others, And thy years unto the cruel;
hmr: Mi danghai kuomah in inzaumna chu pe hlau in ta, Mi bengtlalo kuoma chun in kumhai chu pe hlau rawi in tih.

en: Lest strangers be filled with thy strength, And thy labors be in the house of an alien,
hmr: Hmêlmakhai chu in hrâtnaa suksipin um an ta, In sininrimnahai chu hmêlmak- hai inah ni hlau rawi a tih.

en: And thou mourn at thy latter end, When thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
hmr: In hun tâwp tieng chun inrûm in ta, In taksa le in tisa chu hmangzo a ni pha chun.

en: And say, How have I hated instruction, And my heart despised reproof;
hmr: Chun, “Iengtiziea inchûktirna kha ka lo theida a, Ka lungrilin kâwkna kha a lo ngainêp am a ni aw!

en: Neither have I obeyed the voice of my teachers, Nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
hmr: Ka inchûktirtuhai râwl khawm ka awi ngai nawh a, Kei a mîn chûktirtuhai tienga khawm ka na khawm ka sit ngai nawh a:

en: I was well-nigh in all evil In the midst of the assembly and congregation.
hmr: Siet let dêrna ka lo tlung ṭêp an nâwm ie, Inkhâwmpui pâwlpui laia chun,” ti rawi i tih.

en: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, And running waters out of thine own well.
hmr: I tuibêl ngeia tui le, I tuisunsuo ngeia tui luong chu dâwn rawh.

en: Should thy springs be dispersed abroad, And streams of water in the streets?
hmr: I tuihnârhai chu inluongdartira umin, Khawlaidungahai chun vadungpui tui chu ân dar el ding maw?

en: Let them be for thyself alone, And not for strangers with thee.
hmr: Nangma ta bîk chau ni sienla, I kuoma hmêlmak mihai ta ding ni loin,

en: Let thy fountain be blessed; And rejoice in the wife of thy youth.
hmr: I tuikhur chu malsâwmin um sienla, I tleirâwl lai nuhmeia chun hlim rawh.

en: As a loving hind and a pleasant doe, Let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; And be thou ravished always with her love.
hmr: Sazukpui ditumtak le sakhipui inhawititak angin, Ienglai khawmin a nenêhai chun suktlai rawp sienla che; A hmangainaa chun nang chu thafân rawp hlak rawh.

en: For why shouldest thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, And embrace the bosom of a foreigner?
hmr: Chuongchun, nang ka naupa, iengdingin am hmêlmak nuhmeia chun thafân i ta, Iengdingin am hmêlmak âng chu pawm i ta?

en: For the ways of man are before the eyes of Jehovah; And he maketh level all his paths.
hmr: Mihriem lampuihai chu LALPA mithai hmaah a um sih a, Ama chun a lampuihai po po chu a siemruol hlak.

en: His own iniquities shall take the wicked, And he shall be holden with the cords of his sin.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu ama khaw- hlona ngei chun lâng a ta, A suolna hruihai chun ama khit tlat nîng a tih.

en: He shall die for lack of instruction; And in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
hmr: Inchûktirna tlasamin thîng a ta; Ân vêtna nasat lei chun ama chu invâkhmang a tih.

en: My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbor, If thou hast stricken thy hands for a stranger;
hmr: Ka naupa, i tuolbâwm ta dinga aiawtu i nih a, Hmêlmak mi ta dinga i kuthai i ben chun,

en: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, Thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
hmr: I baua thuhai ngei chun âwk i na; I baua thuhai ngei chun man i ni tah.

en: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, Seeing thou art come into the hand of thy neighbor: Go, humble thyself, and importune thy neighbor;
hmr: Tuhin hi hi thaw la, ka naupa, nangma le nangma chu insansuok rawh, I tuolbâwm kuta chun i lût a ni ta sih a; Fe la, nang le nang chu insukhnuoi la, i tuolbâwm chu ngên rawh.

en: Give not sleep to thine eyes, Nor slumber to thine eyelids;
hmr: I mithai chu inna inhmutir naw la, I mitkhohai chu ininnghiltir bawk naw rawh.

en: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, And as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
hmr: Ramsuoktu kuta sakhi a suok angin le, Vate vêtua inthawka vate a suok ang elin, Nang le nangma chu insansuok rawh.

en: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; Consider her ways, and be wise:
hmr: Nang thabo, phaivâng kuomah fe la, A lampuihai ngaituo la, var rawh.

en: Which having no chief, Overseer, or ruler,
hmr: Chu chun lal a nei nawh a, Enkawltu amanih, rorêltu amani khawm a nei nawh.

en: Provideth her bread in the summer, And gathereth her food in the harvest.
hmr: Nipui lai a bu a siekhâwl a, Busîk hunah a bu a lâk khâwm hlak.

en: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
hmr: Aw thabo, ieng chen am i zâl ding a na? I zâlnaa inthawkin iengtik âm i tho ding a na?

en: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep:
hmr: Zâl dep bêk, in dep bêk, Zâla kuthai hang thlep dep bêk.

en: So shall thy poverty come as a robber, And thy want as an armed man.
hmr: Chuongchun, inru angin i pasietna chu hung a ta, I tlâksamna chu mi râlthuoma inthuom angin hung a tih.

en: A worthless person, a man of iniquity, Is he that walketh with a perverse mouth;
hmr: Mi hmangna bo, mi khawhlo, Bau chapotakin a lêng a.

en: That winketh with his eyes, that speaketh with his feet, That maketh signs with his fingers;
hmr: A mithai a sêp a, a kehaiin thu a hril a, A kuthaiin inchiknahai ân chûktir a.

en: In whose heart is perverseness, Who deviseth evil continually, Who soweth discord.
hmr: A lungrila chun kâwmâwna a um a, thilsuol a rawt suok rawp a, Indarna a tu hlak.

en: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; On a sudden shall he be broken, and that without remedy.
hmr: Chuleiin, a lungzîngna chu hung thut a ta, Thâwk le khatin kawidar a ta, dam nâwkna boin.

en: There are six things which Jehovah hateth; Yea, seven which are an abomination unto him:
hmr: Thil paruk LALPAIN a theidahai chu a um a, Anih, pasari, chuong chu ama ta dingin tirdakum an nih;

en: Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, And hands that shed innocent blood;
hmr: Mit mengsânghai, lei khêlhlip, Pawitâwklo thisen insuoktir hlak kuthai le chun,

en: A heart that deviseth wicked purposes, Feet that are swift in running to mischief,
hmr: Ngaituona suol ngairuot hlak lungril le, Pawi tâwk dinga ke tlân hrât hlakhai leh;

en: A false witness that uttereth lies, And he that soweth discord among brethren.
hmr: Hrietpuitu indiklo khêlthu sâksuok hlaktu, Unauhai laia indarna tu hlaktu le chun.

en: My son, keep the commandment of thy father, And forsake not the law of thy mother:
hmr: Ka naupa, i pa thupêk hi kawl tlat la, I nu inchûktirna hi nghatsan bawk naw rawh.

en: Bind them continually upon thy heart; Tie them about thy neck.
hmr: I lungrila chun khuopde tlat zing la, I rîng vêla chun zem tlat rawh.

en: When thou walkest, it shall lead thee; When thou sleepest, it shall watch over thee; And when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
hmr: I fe pha chun nang chu ṭhuoi a ti cheh a; I in pha chun nang chu vêng a ti cheh a; Chun, i hung meng pha khawm chun inbiekpui a ti che.

en: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; And reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
