hmr: Thupêk chu khâwnvar a na, inchûktirna chu var a ni sih a; Inchûktirna thununnahai chu hringna lampui a nih;

en: To keep thee from the evil woman, From the flattery of the foreigner’s tongue.
hmr: Nuhmei riloa inthawka hum ding chein le, Hmêlmak baua inpâk tehlêmnaa inthawka vêng ding chein.

en: Lust not after her beauty in thy heart; Neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
hmr: I lungrila chun a mawina chu châk naw la, A mitsîrhai chun nang chu kuoi bawk naw raw se che.

en: For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a piece of bread; And the adulteress hunteth for the precious life.
hmr: Nuhmei hur lei hin pasal chu bei hlekah siem a ni hlak a nih, Chun, uirenu chun hringna hlu chu a pêlin a pêl hlak.

en: Can a man take fire in his bosom, And his clothes not be burned?
hmr: Miin a kalakah a puonhai kâng loin, Mei a chepdê thei am a nih?

en: Or can one walk upon hot coals, And his feet not be scorched?
hmr: Annawleh, mi a ke kâng loin, Meiling chungah a lâwn thei am a nih?

en: So he that goeth in to his neighbor’s wife; Whosoever toucheth her shall not be unpunished.
hmr: Mi a tuolbâwm nuhmei kuoma lût chu chuong ang bawk chu a na; Amanu va tâwk taphawt chu hrem naw ni naw nih.

en: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal To satisfy himself when he is hungry:
hmr: Inruin a phîngṭâm laiin ân sukkhawpna dinga ân rûk chun mihaiin an hmusit ngai nawh a.

en: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; He shall give all the substance of his house.
hmr: Amiruokchu ama chu hmu suok a ni chun a lêt sariin thung a ta; A ina thuomhnaw po po chu pe vawng a tih.

en: He that committeth adultery with a woman is void of understanding: He doeth it who would destroy his own soul.
hmr: Nuhmei le uiretna thil thawtu chu lungril bo a na, Ama lungril ngei sukse dingin thil a thaw a nih.

en: Wounds and dishonor shall he get; And his reproach shall not be wiped away.
hmr: Inhliemna le hmaimâwkna hmûng a ta, A hmaimâwkna chu hrûk hmang ni naw nih.

en: For jealousy is the rage of a man; And he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
hmr: Itthîkna hi mihriem lungsenna a na, Phubalâk ni chun hla naw nih.

en: He will not regard any ransom; Neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
hmr: Intlanna hrim hrim ngaisak naw nih a, Thilpêk tamtakhai chu pe la khawm, lungawi el chuong naw nih.

en: My son, keep my words, And lay up my commandments with thee.
hmr: Ka naupa, ka thu hi kawl la, Ka thupêkhai hi nangmaa chun siekhâwl rawh.

en: Keep my commandments and live; And my law as the apple of thine eye.
hmr: Ka thupêkhai hi kawlin khawsa la, Ka închûktirna chu i mitnautê angin;

en: Bind them upon thy fingers; Write them upon the tablet of thy heart.
hmr: I kutpârhaia chun khuopde la, I lungril phêk chunga chun ziek rawh.

en: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; And call understanding thy kinswoman:
hmr: Varna kuoma chun, “Nang chu ka farnu i nih,” ti la, Hrietthiemna chu i laibungah inbûk rawh.

en: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, From the foreigner that flattereth with her words.
hmr: Hmêlmak nuhmeia inthawka an kawl theina ding chein, Hmêlmak a thuhaia zaihlêmtu chea inthawk chun.

en: For at the window of my house I looked forth through my lattice;
hmr: Ka in tukverah, Ka thirlêna chun ka en hlak sih a.

en: And I beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, A young man void of understanding,
hmr: Chuongchun, mi mâwlhai laia chun ka en a, Tleirâwlhai laia chun, Hrietthiemna bo tlangvâl ka hmuh a.

en: Passing through the street near her corner; And he went the way to her house,
hmr: Ama chun amanu tuol kawtthlêra chun fein, Amanu in lampui chu a hraw a,

en: In the twilight, in the evening of the day, In the middle of the night and in the darkness.
hmr: Chu ni zântiengah, thimtham hnuoiah; Zân mâwk inthim mup hnuoia chun.

en: And, behold, there met him a woman With the attire of a harlot, and wily of heart.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, chutaka chun nuhmei, Nawchizawr inthuoma inthuom, lungril inlêktak ân tuokpui a.

en: (She is clamorous and wilful; Her feet abide not in her house:
hmr: Amanu chu mi bautam ngalhrâttak a na, A ina hrim a ke chu a um hman ngai nawh a.

en: Now she is in the streets, now in the broad places, And lieth in wait at every corner.)
hmr: Kawtthlêra le khawlai dunghaia umin, Kil tina inchânin a nghâk zing a.

en: So she caught him, and kissed him, And with an impudent face she said unto him:
hmr: Chuongchun, amanu chun ama chu a man a, a fâwp tah a, Chun, hmêl iniemtakin a kuomah a hril tah a;

en: Sacrifices of peace-offerings are with me; This day have I paid my vows.
hmr: “Inremna thilinhlânhai inthâwina inhlân ding ka nih a, Hi ni hin ka thutiemhai chu kân thien tah a.

en: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, Diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
hmr: Chuleiin, nangma tuok ding chein ka hung suok a nih; Taimataka i hmêl zawng dingin, chuongchun, ka hmu suok ta che hi.

en: I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry, With striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.
hmr: Ka khum chu puon cheimawi inkhumin ka chei tah a, Puon ṭielhai Aiguptaa khâwng chun.

en: I have perfumed my bed With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
hmr: Ka khum chu riminhnik ka theh a, Murra le, beraw le, thingzungthakin.

en: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning; Let us solace ourselves with loves.
hmr: Hung la, zingkâr chenin ei hmangaina sipzak lâng ei ta, Hmangainahaiin eini chu inhnêm ei tih,

en: For the man is not at home; He is gone a long journey:
hmr: Ka pasal chu inah a um nawh a, Khuol ram hlatakah a fe ta sih a.

en: He hath taken a bag of money with him; He will come home at the full moon.
hmr: Ama chun tangka fûn a chawi a, Thla lir pha leh hung tlung a tih,” tiin.

en: With her much fair speech she causeth him to yield; With the flattering of her lips she forceth him along.
hmr: Amanu thu hril ṭha chun ama chu ân pêktir tah a; A hmûrhai zaihlêmna chun ama chu a tirlui tah a.

en: He goeth after her straightway, As an ox goeth to the slaughter, Or as one in fetters to the correction of the fool;
hmr: Ama chun amanu chu a zui nghâl a, Bâwngchal sathattu kuoma fe ang elin, Annawleh, invêt sukdikna dinga thîrkawl bun ang elin,

en: Till an arrow strike through his liver; As a bird hasteth to the snare, And knoweth not that it is for his life.
hmr: Thalin a thin chu a sunthleng hmakhata, Vatein châng a baw ang elin, A nun thlengna ding a nih ti hre loin.

en: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me, And attend to the words of my mouth.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin ka nau- pasalhai, mi lo ngai unla, Ka baua thuhai hi pawisa ta u.

en: Let not thy heart decline to her ways; Go not astray in her paths.
hmr: A lampuihaia chun in lungril innghat naw sienla, A lampuihai chu zui bawk naw ro.

en: For she hath cast down many wounded: Yea, all her slain are a mighty host.
hmr: Mi tamtak chu hliemin a peithlûk ta sih a; Anih, a sukhlumhai po po chu sipai râlhrâthai an nih.

en: Her house is the way to Sheol, Going down to the chambers of death.
hmr: Amanu in chu Seol fena lampui a na, Thina pindana lûtthla chu.

en: Doth not wisdom cry, And understanding put forth her voice?
hmr: Varna chu a khêkin, Hrietthiemna chun a râwl ân suo a ni naw am a nih?

en: On the top of high places by the way, Where the paths meet, she standeth;
hmr: Lampui sîra hmun insânghaia chun, Lampui ṭhuom laihaia chun a ngîr a;

en: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, At the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud:
hmr: Khawpui lûtnaa, dâikawtkhâr sîrahai, Kawtkhâr lûtnaahai chun a khêk rak rak a;

en: Unto you, O men, I call; And my voice is to the sons of men.
hmr: “In kuomah, aw mihriemhai, ka khêk a, Ka râwl chu mihriem naupahai kuomah kân suo a nih.

en: O ye simple, understand prudence; And, ye fools, be of an understanding heart.
hmr: Aw nang mi mâwl, varna hung hrethiem ta la, Chun, nangni invêthai, hriet- thiemna lungril hung nei ro.

en: Hear, for I will speak excellent things; And the opening of my lips shall be right things.
hmr: Ngai ta u, thil ṭha bîkhai ka hril ding a ni sih a, Ka hmûrhai kâkna chu thil indik a ni ding a nih.

en: For my mouth shall utter truth; And wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
hmr: Ka bau chun thudik sâksuok a ta, Khawhlona chu ka hmûrhai ta dingin tirdakum a ni sih a.

en: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
hmr: Ka baua thu po pohai chu felna a na, Annia chun a kâwi amanih, a khêl amani khawm a um nawh.

en: They are all plain to him that understandeth, And right to them that find knowledge.
hmr: A hrethiemtu ta ding chun a fie vawng a, Hrietna hmu suoktuhai ta ding chun ân dik vawng bawk a nih.

en: Receive my instruction, and not silver; And knowledge rather than choice gold.
hmr: Tangka ni loin, ka inchûktirna hi lo pawm ro, Rangkachak ditumtak nêkin hrietna chu lo chang bawk unla.

en: For wisdom is better than rubies; And all the things that may be desired are not to be compared unto it.
hmr: Lunghluhai nêkin varna chu a ṭha lem sih a; Thil po po dit thei taphawthai chu ama le hrilkhi ding a um nawh.

en: I wisdom have made prudence my dwelling, And find out knowledge and discretion.
hmr: Kei varna hin varna chu ka chêngnaah ka hmang a, Hrietna le ngairuotthiemna chu ka hmu suok a.

en: The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil: Pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, And the perverse mouth, do I hate.
hmr: LALPA ṭi chu suolna theidana ding a na, Chapona le, insuklienna le rîtlona kawng leh, Bau chapo hi ka theida a nih.

en: Counsel is mine, and sound knowledge: I am understanding; I have might.
hmr: Thurâwnna chu ka ta a na, hrietna hrisêl leh, Hrethiemin ka um a, thilthawtheina ka nei a nih.

en: By me kings reign, And princes decree justice.
hmr: Lalhaiin keimain ro an rêl a, Lal nauhai chun keimain rorêl dik chu an sukthlûk bawk a.

en: By me princes rule, And nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
hmr: Rorêltuhai chun keimain ro an rêl a, Mi ṭhahai le, hnuoi chunga rorêltuhai po po chun.

en: I love them that love me; And those that seek me diligently shall find me.
hmr: A mi hmangaituhai chu ka hmangai veh a, Chun, nguntaka a mi zawngtuhai chun mi hmu suok bawk an tih.

en: Riches and honor are with me; Yea, durable wealth and righteousness.
hmr: Hausakna le inzâkaina chu ka kuomah a um a, Hausaknahai le felna tlotak el chu.

en: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; And my revenue than choice silver.
hmr: Ka ra chu rângkachak nêkin, anih, rângkachak inthieng nêkin a ṭha lem a, Ka pungna khawm chu tangka ditumtak nêkin a ṭha lem.

en: I walk in the way of righteousness, In the midst of the paths of justice;
hmr: Felna lampuia chun ka feh a, Rorêlna lampuitakhaia chun.

en: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, And that I may fill their treasuries.
hmr: Kei a mi hmangaituhai chu thil nei dinga ka siem theina ding le, An sum inhai chu ka suksip theina dingin.

en: Jehovah possessed me in the beginning of his way, Before his works of old.
hmr: LALPA chun a lampui inṭanna angin a mi siem a, Inhmata a sinthawhai hmasatak angin.

en: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, Before the earth was.
hmr: Atîra inthawk, chatuona indinin ka um a, Hnuoi hrim la um hmain.

en: When there were no depths, I was brought forth, When there were no fountains abounding with water.
hmr: Tuipuihai a um naw laiin lâk suokin ka um a, Tuikhurhai tuia sipa umhai um naw lai chun.

en: Before the mountains were settled, Before the hills was I brought forth;
hmr: Tlânghai siemrêl an ni hmain, Muolhai hma daiin, lâk suok ka ni tah a;

en: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, Nor the beginning of the dust of the world.
hmr: Ramhai le hnuoi a la siem naw lai le, Khawvêl pilvut inṭan hma dai bawk chun.

en: When he established the heavens, I was there: When he set a circle upon the face of the deep,
hmr: Vânhai chu a buotsai lai chun, chutaka chun ka um a, Tuipui chung inkuol a siem lai chun;

en: When he made firm the skies above, When the fountains of the deep became strong,
hmr: Vâna sûmhai a siem laiin, Tuipui tuikhurhai chu a sukdet lai chun.

en: When he gave to the sea its bound, That the waters should not transgress his commandment, When he marked out the foundations of the earth;
hmr: Chuong lai chun tuipui ta dingin tiemchin a pêk a, Tuihai chun a thupêk chu an bawsiet nawna dingin, Leihnuoi lungphûmhai chu a ruot lai chun:

en: Then I was by him, as a master workman; And I was daily his delight, Rejoicing always before him,
hmr: Chuong lai chun amaa chun sinthaw hotu ang ka lo ni tah a; Chun, ama hmaa chun hlima um rawpin, Ni tina a lâwmna chu ka lo ni tah a.

en: Rejoicing in his habitable earth; And my delight was with the sons of men.
hmr: A leihnuoi chêng theinaa chun hlima umin, Ka lâwmna chu mihriem nau- pahai chungah a ni tah a.

en: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me; For blessed are they that keep my ways.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, ka naupa- salhai mi lo ngai unla, Ka lampui hrawtuhai chu mi hamṭha an ni sih a.

en: Hear instruction, and be wise, And refuse it not.
hmr: Inchûktirna chu ngai unla, var unla, Dit naw hrim hrim naw ro.

en: Blessed is the man that heareth me, Watching daily at my gates, Waiting at the posts of my doors.
hmr: Ka thu hretu chu mi hamṭha a nih, Ka dâikawtkhâra ni tina nghâktu, Ka kawtkhâr bienga nghâk zingtu chu.

en: For whoso findeth me findeth life, And shall obtain favor of Jehovah.
hmr: Tukhawm a mi hmu suoktu chun hringna chu a hmu suok a, LALPA ditsakna chu chang a tih.

en: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: All they that hate me love death.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ka chunga suksuol chun ama lungril ngei a sukkhawhlo a, Kei a mi theidatuhai po po chun thina an hmangai a nih.”

en: Wisdom hath builded her house; She hath hewn out her seven pillars:
hmr: Varna chun a in chu a bâwl a, A lungban pasarihai chu a phun tah a.

en: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; She hath also furnished her table:
hmr: A ranhai chu a that a, a uoin chu a chawkpawl tah a, A dawkân khawm chu a siemrêl ta bawk a.

en: She hath sent forth her maidens; She crieth upon the highest places of the city:
hmr: A nunghâkhai chu a tir suok a, Khawpui hmun insângtakhaia chun an khêk a,

en: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: As for him that is void of understanding, she saith to him,
hmr: “Tukhawm mi mâwl chu hi tieng hin hung raw se,” tiin. Hrietthiemna boa um ta ding chun, a kuomah a hril a,

en: Come, eat ye of my bread, And drink of the wine which I have mingled.
hmr: “Hung la, ka bei hung fa la, Ka uoin chawkpawl chu hung dâwn rawh.

en: Leave off, ye simple ones, and live; And walk in the way of understanding.
hmr: Nang mi mâwl, mâwlna chu mâksanin khawsa la, Hrietthiemna lampui chu hung hraw rawh,” tiin.

en: He that correcteth a scoffer getteth to himself reviling; And he that reproveth a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
hmr: Hmusittu siemṭhatu chun inzakna a hmu hlak a; Mi khawhlo kâwktu chun kut thlâkna a tuok hlak.

en: Reprove not a scoffer, lest he hate thee: Reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.
hmr: Hmusittu chu kâwk naw rawh, chuong naw chun, theida rawi a ti che. Mi var chu kâwk la, ama chun hmangai a ti che.

en: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: Teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
hmr: Mi var kuoma chun inchûktirna pe la, ama chu hung var nâwk sawt a ta, Mi fel chu inchûktir la, ama chu thiemnaa chun hung pung a tih.

en: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom; And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
hmr: LALPA ṭi chu varna bul a nih, Mi Inthieng hrietna chu hrietthiemna bul a ni bawk.

en: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, And the years of thy life shall be increased.
hmr: Keimaa chun i nihai chu belsa nîng a ta, I dam sûng kumhai chu sukpung nîng an tih.

en: If thou art wise, thou art wise for thyself; And if thou scoffest, thou alone shalt bear it.
hmr: I var chun, nangma ta dinga var i na, I hmusit chun, nangma ngeiin phur i tih.

en: The foolish woman is clamorous; She is simple, and knoweth nothing.
hmr: Nuhmei invêt chu a hmûr a thiem a, Ama chu a mâwl a, iengkhawm a hriet nawh.

en: And she sitteth at the door of her house, On a seat in the high places of the city,
hmr: A in kawtkhâra chun a ṭhung a, Khawpui hmun insânghaia ṭhungnaa chun,

en: To call to them that pass by, Who go right on their ways:
hmr: Mi fe inlawnhai ko dingin, Chuong an lampuia fe peihai chu,

en: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither; And as for him that is void of understanding, she saith to him,
hmr: “Tukhawm mi mâwl chu, hi tieng hung raw se,” tiin. Hrietthiemna boa um ta ding chun a hril a:

en: Stolen waters are sweet, And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
hmr: “Tui inrûkhai chu a thlum a, Fienriela bei fâk chu ân hnik bawk a,” tiin.

en: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mithihai chu chutaka chun an um ti a hriet nawh a, Amanu mikhuolhai khawm chu Seol lipuia chun an um ti a hriet bawk nawh.
